loans.name: Alindor Hipólito

texts.es:
Hipólito tiene 53 años de edad, es soltero; vive en su casa propia de material rústico herencia de su padre por un lapso de más de 40 años, en Pucará a dos horas de la cuidad e Jaén que se encuentra ubicado en la Región Cajamarca sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica desde hace 25 años a la actividad de reparación de todo tipo de calzado tiene clientela fija, su taller artesanal está ubicado en su domicilio; ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para adquirir mercadería para implementar su taller y de esta manera poder tener ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hipólito is 53, single, and has lived in in Pucará, in a home made of recycled materials that he inherited from his father, for over 40 years. Pucará is two hours from Jaén, in Cajamarca Region in the northern sierra of Peru.

Hipólito has for 25 years repaired all kinds of shoes. He has a workshop in his home and has a base of loyal customers. He has applied for a loan of 500 new soles to purchase tools for his workshop so that he can offer his customers better service.

loans.use: to purchase tools for a shoe repair workshop.

loans.name: Sinza E Group

texts.en:
Hamis, who is in his early thirties, is married with one child, who is in school. For eight years now, Hamis had had a cafe business. He is doing very well in this business. Hamis starts his business activities from 6:00 a.m. and operates until mid night and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This is his sixteenth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to repair his business premises by painting and putting in ceiling tiles. He used his previous loans to buy food and cooking items for his business. He managed to improve more in his business and has employed a few helpers. Hamis has successfully paid back all of his previous loans. With the business profit he received, he paid school fees and household expenses and built a house. He dreams that one day he will be able to expand his business. 

Hamis will share this loan with his loan group Sinza E, which totals seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to repair his business premises by painting and putting in ceiling tiles.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is a farmer from Ubay, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of two children. He has been in the farming business for more than three years. He also runs a sari-sari or variety store.

Ricardo is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional stock for the grocery store like noodles, canned goods, soap, toiletries, soda and other beverages. With this assistance, he will be able to improve the productivity of his farm as well as his store. In the future, Ricardo hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional stock for the grocery store like noodles, canned goods, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages

loans.name: Nativo

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 27 años de edad, vive desde hace 20 años en casa de su tía en el Distrito de Pucara a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, en la región Cajamarca sierra norte del Perú.

El trabaja como chofer de una mototaxi por las mañanas transportando a los estudiantes hasta su centro educativo y además realiza el transporte de sus clientes a los caseríos más cercanos de su distrito.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para brindar mantenimiento a su vehículo.
texts.en: For 20 years, Santiago, 27, has lived in his aunt's house in the Pucara district, located two hours from Jaén, Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. He drives a motor-taxi in the mornings, taking students to the school and also taking clients to the ranches closest to the district. He has applied for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to maintain his vehicle.

loans.use: to maintain his motor-taxi.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married, has three children and helps her husband in operating their own farm, raising vegetables to sell. She has been involved in the farm for many long years. Aside from this, she also buys charcoal and resells it in town. 

Lydia has taken a loan from GDMPC to purchase organic fertilizer and vegetable seeds. She wants to get more returns from her farm and use the proceeds in her buy and sell business. She wantsa to improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, tiene 33 años de edad, tiene a su cargo dos hijos, ella vive en el municipio de Nueva frontera, Santa Bárbara. Hace varios años que ella tiene su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar. Vende manteca, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, embutidos, carne de pollo, maíz, productos enlatados, churros, pastillas, etc. Ha solicitado otro préstamo que es por 15,000 lempiras, con el cual va surtir más el negocio y aumentar su clientela. Comprara carne de pollo, embutidos, maiz, frijoles, manteca y otros abarrotes. Ella tiene como meta hacer crecer el negocio y mejorar las condiciones de su familia y mejorar el nivel economico.
texts.en:
Sonia, 33, is responsible for her two children. She lives in Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. She has operated her own business, a grocery shop where she sells basic items, for several years. She offers margarine, sugar, rice, beans, canned goods, sausages, chicken, corn, canned goods, churros, pills, and more. 

She has applied for another loan of 15,000 lempiras to buy merchandise and build her customers base. She will buy chicken, sausages, corn, beans, margarine, and other items. Her goal is to grow her business and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like corn, beans, margarine, meat, canned goods, and other items to sell in her grocery shop.

loans.name: Shafiq

texts.en:
Shafiq is 30 years old and the father of two daughters living in Lahore, Pakistan. He is religious, sympathetic, honest and a hard worker. 

Shafiq is running a small herbal shop in a nearby town to help the poor people. Because he wanted to help the poor, he decided to open herbal medicine shop in poor society for those who do not have the power to afford allopathic medicine. He can also treat minor diseases at a very low service charge and provide herbal medicines according to his experience. In this way, he gets some income to run his house as well.

Shafiq is very famous in his area due to his kindness. This is the reason the demand for herbal medicine has been increasing. He needs to buy more herbal medicine to cope with the demand. He wants to buy herbal medicine in bulk, but does not have enough capital to invest because he has to spend a large part of his savings on household expenses.

Therefore, Shafiq has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. He hopes that the lenders will support him in his noble work.

loans.use: To buy herbal medicne for herbal shop.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is married and works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Teresa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Teresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is from the small village of Didi Nedzi. He is 52 years old and lives with his wife in his own house. 

Badri runs an agricultural business and breeds four milk cows, two calves and a pig.  Badri’s wife Madona produces cheese to sell with the received milk. The couple also sells nuts, maize and laurel leaves which are grown on their piece of land. In addition, Badri has a tractor and serves local farmers on tilling and planting seasons in return for a service fee.

Badri and Madona work hard all day long, but their earnings are modest for the purposes of saving and improving their standard of living.

Badri is requesting a start-up loan to purchase a mini-bus. He will use it as a school bus and transport local children to school, which is located very far from the village. The children go to school with difficulty, and it takes them much time.  The school administration will pay for the service, and Badri will generate income. 

Badri and his villagers hope for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus for transporting schoolchildren

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 57-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Emma has a buy-and-sell bananas business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Emma has been in this business for 17 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 43 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 57 years old and married, with five children. 

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and she has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Evangeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Bonanza Group

texts.es:
Bonanza es un grupo nuevo, está en su primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, están con muchas expectativas y muy animadas de seguir trabajando y mejorando sus vidas. Están también haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de cada una y así trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gabriela quien se dedica a la  venta  de comidas también se debe destacar que sus comestibles son muy pedidos por sus clientes, y es gracias a eso que le está yendo muy bien y ayuda a su familia. Está luchando por mejorar y quiere seguir creciendo poco a poco y por medio de su esfuerzo.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, dulces, verduras, aceite y otros para poder hacer sus comidas y generar más ingresos el cual la ayudara a mejorar  su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Bonanza is a new group.  They are in their first loan cycle of the entrepreneurial women's program.  They have high expectations and are very excited to keep working and improving their lives.  They are also doing poverty elimination surveys in order to find out and work on everyone's situation.

One of the members, Gabriela, earns her living selling food.  She points out that her meals are highly requested by her clients, and thanks to that things are going very well for her and she's helping out her family.  She's fighting to improve and wants her efforts to her keep growing little by little.

Gabriela is seeking this loan to buy flour, sugar, sweets, vegetables, oils, etc., to make her meals and generate more income, which will help improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, sweets, vegetables, oil, etc.

loans.name: Jamolidin

texts.en:
Jamolidin is young and hard-working.  He is not married and has no child. He lives with his parents. 

Jamolidin always wanted to provide his family with a good quality of life. He has good experience for feeding cattle. He decided to start a new business in  animal husbandry in order to generate income that he can contribute to his home’s finances. He will manage the business alone. 

He is going to buy cattle, feed them some months, and sell them in the local market. He is asking for a loan of TJS 14,000 to buy cattle for organizing his new business.

He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Meguela

texts.en:
Meguela is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal and bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal and bananas to sell.

Meguela has been in this business for six years. She earns other income from raising livestock.

Meguela has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal and bananas to sell

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 49 years old and married with seven children.

Melba works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 (Philippine pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Melba has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty-seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

Melba aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Diarra

texts.fr:
Âgée de 30 ans, la dame Diarra est un sociétaire d’un des guichets de l’IMCEC. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la vente de chaussures, sacs, tissus ou elle a acquis une expérience de plus de 5 ans. Elle a démarré avec un capital de 50.000 FCFA, somme qui lui a été remis par son époux pour l’appuyer. Diarra possède une clientèle régulière qui fait la commande avant qu’elle ne parte acheter la marchandise. Avec les revenus de l’activité, elle donne sa participation dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne de la famille.
Diarra, sur la photo, montre une partie de la marchandise qu’elle vend ; des chaussures. Les tissus et les sacs ont été liquidés beaucoup plus rapidement.
Elle rêve de devenir une grande commerçante et d’ouvrir un grand magasin de vente de prêt à porter associé à ce qu’elle vend d’habitude. Cela elle l’espère le réaliser avec l’appui de l’IMCEC.
texts.en: At 30 years old, the lady Diarra is a member of one of the branches of IMCEC. She is a married mother. She sells shoes, purses, and fabric, where she has been gaining experience for more than five years. She started with 50,000 FCFA in capital, which was given to her by her husband to support her. Diarra has a regular clientele who places orders before she leaves to buy the merchandise. With the profits, she helps pay for the daily expenses of her family. In the photo, Diarra is showing a part of the merchandise she sells: shoes. The fabric and purses were sold a lot more quickly. She dreams of becoming a big seller and opening a big ready-to-wear store, which matches with what she normally sells. She hopes to make this a reality with the help of IMCEC.

loans.use: to buy shoes, purses, and fabric to sell

loans.name: Ferdy

texts.en:
Ferdy is a 59-year-old man, married to Katarina, a 60-year-old woman. They are blessed with six children: two are married, three of them are working, and the last one is still at school. 

In order to generate income for his family, Ferdy established a brick business three years ago using his own capital.  Since last year, he has been running a brick vent business to increase the income; he hires three employees to help him make bricks. 

At the moment, he received a number of brick orders, so therefore he requested an individual loan of 4,500,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiah) from TLM to buy 25 sacks of cement and 6 cubic meters of soil.

loans.use: to buy 25 sacks of cement and 6 cubic meters of soil.

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Porvenir está en su 1er ciclo del programa de comité de jóvenes, donde tienen el deseo de poder emprender una actividad y sentirse útiles y ayudar con algo a sus familias, son jóvenes con gran visión y sueños.
Regina es parte de este grupo, quien es estudiante y también se dedica a hacer y vender bijouterie. Ella quiere ser una buena profesional el dia de mañana y es por eso que esta luchando.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertir en lentejuelas, perlas, y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus bijouterie y poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradece esta oportunidad que como joven recibe.
En la foto del grupo aparecen mas personas, ya que también están los codeudores que firman con ellos.
texts.en:
The Porvenir [Future] group is in its first loan cycle in the Youth Committee Program where they have the desire to be able to be in business and feel useful and help their families out.  They are young with grand visions and dreams.  

Regina is part of this group.  She's a student and also sells jewelry.  She want to be a good career-woman tout suite and that's what she's fighting for.  

She's requesting this loan to invest in sequins, pearls, and the rest of the supplies she needs to continue making and selling jewelry.  She appreciates this opportunity that, even as a young person, she is receiving.  

There are additional people in the photo above because they are also signed on as co-borrowers.

loans.use: to buy sequins, pearls, and other supplies to make jewelry.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married, with five children, and she helped her husband by opening a retail store in their community. Her husband works in the government as a PNP.  

As an aid to his income, she planned to open a retail business. Recently, she had joined GDMPC and borrowed money to purchase grocery goods to sell in her retail store. 

She is hopeful to gain more returns and use them for the basic needs of her family. In the future, she wants to see her children successful.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods to sell in her retail store

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her.  She was able to buy materials for her tailoring business. Her loan was also helpful in the education of her children. 

As of now, she is focusing more on her junk shop, although she is still accepting some seasonal demands for repairs and alterations. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another PHP 20,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund to buy scrap and recyclable materials. 

Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Raquel dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She values the time spent in the weekly fellowship* as it strengthens her faith in God. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years now.

Crisanta successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her food vending business. She requested a PHP 10,000 (Philippine pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, salt, noodles, etc. for her business.

In the future, Crisanta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, salt, noodles, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle-operator business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from fish vending and rice retailing. 

Ramona is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Ramona has sustained her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 56 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, hair conditioner, cooking oil, canned goods, soft drinks, diapers, etc. 

Cecilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is running a retail store in their community. Aside from this, she also sells beauty products and cosmetics to earn an extra income for a living. She has been in this business for more than five years, and she always find ways to sustain and improve the business for the good of her family. 

She joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a loan to purchase more goods like canned goods, sugar, milk and bottled products to sell. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like canned goods, sugar, milk and bottled products.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA ont en moyenne  40 ans, 1 enfant et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  YANGASSO dans le cercle de BLA (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires.
 Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents,  les femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA sont à leur 5 eme   prêt solidaire. AWANI 2 eme femme de la gauche  vers la droite compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, deux sacs de riz   de 100kg, des condiments, des légumes et des tubercules. Elles s’approvisionnent à YANGASSO et SAN pendant les jours des foires. Elles effectuent ses ventes, sur place à YANGASSO, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 38 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the DJANTOYERELA group are all women who have an average age of 40 years and 1 child each. They all live in traditional extended families in Yangasso in the circle of BLA (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali) .
The women know each other through family ties. They buy and sell general food products for a living.
After successfully repaying their previous loans, the women in the DJANTOYERELA group are now taking out their 5th group loan. AWANI is the 2nd woman from the left. She plans to use her portion of the loan to buy two 100 kg bags of rice, condiments, vegetables and tubers. They get their supplies from YANGASSO and SAN on market days. They sell their products in YANGASSO to a customer-based consisting of women and men. She plans to make an average monthly profit of 38,000 FCFA that she will use to cover health, food, clothing and education costs. She will reinvest the rest of the money in her business.

loans.use: to buy general food supplies

loans.name: Djiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUISEME ont en moyenne  50 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  YANGASSO dans le cercle de BLA (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente graines de céréales de condiments et de tissus.
 Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJIGUISEME sont à leur 13 eme   prêt solidaire. AISSATA 2 eme femme de la droite vers la gauche compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une balle de tissu wax et  des complets de prêt à porter pour les adultes. Elles effectuent ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 47 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en: The women of the DJIGUISEME group are on average 50 years old, have two children, and all live in traditional expanded families in Yangasso in the BLA circle (fourth administrative region in the republic of Mali). These women met through family connections and sell cereal, grains, spices, and fabric. After having properly repaid previous loans, the women of the DJIGUISEME group are on their 13th group loan. AISSATA, the second woman from the right, plans to use her loan to buy a roll of Wax fabric and ready-to-wear suits for adults. She sells to a clientele composed of women and men for cash and often for credit. She foresees earning a monthly profit of 47,000 FCFA, which will be used for costs relating to health, food, clothing, and school dues, with the rest being reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
As the married mother of seven children, Antonia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from food vending. Antonia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Antonia has sustained her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Félix

texts.fr: Félix âgé de 33 ans, est marié à une coiffeuse nommée Rachelle. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et aucun à leur charge. Félix n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la coiffure ; activité qu'il exerce depuis quinze ans dans sa région, ce qui lui permet de répondre aisément aux besoins de sa famille. Félix vend également des chaussures dans son atelier. Félix vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les charges de la maison son supportées par le couple. Dans le but de renforcer ses prestations, Félix sollicite pour la quatrième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Félix, 33, is married to a hairstylist named Rachelle. The couple has three children, some of whom attend school, and nobody else is in their care. Félix didn’t attend school but learned hairstyling, a business he’s been in for fifteen years in his region, which allows him to easily meet the needs of his family. Félix also sells shoes in his studio. Félix lives with his wife and his children. The household expenses are split by the couple. In the goal of reinforcing his funds, Félix is seeking for the fourth time financial support from ALIDé. The previous loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy hairstyling products and shoes

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe TIESSIRI ont en moyenne  42 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  YANGASSO dans le cercle de BLA (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente d’articles divers.
 Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur 4 eme   prêt solidaire. 
AMINATA 1ere femme assise de la gauche  vers la droite  compte acheter des douzaines de paires de chaussures en plastiques pour enfants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 26 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en: The women of the TIESSIRI group are on average 42 years old, have two children, and all live in traditional expanded families in Yangasso in the BLA circle (fourth administrative region in the republic of Mali). These women met through family connections and sell diverse products. After having properly repaid previous loans, the women of the TIESSIRI group are on their 4th group loan. Aminata, the woman seated on the left, plans to buy dozens of pairs of plastic shoes for children. She sells her products to a clientele composed of women and men for cash and often on credit. She foresees making a monthly profit of 26,000 FCFA, which will be used for costs relating to health, food, clothing, and school dues, with the rest being reinvested in her business

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn. She previously accessed a loan of 14,000 PHP that she used to purchase greater quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in her family's personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another loan of 29,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn hopes that her variety store will someday become a grocery store. She dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary Glynda

texts.en:
Mary Glynda is 46 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by running a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Mary Glynda is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her business.

Mary Glynda has been fattening pigs for seven years and also earns income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 44 years old and married, with four children.

Melba works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Melba has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for eight years, and she also earns an income from selling feed.

Melba aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Iftikhar

texts.en:
Greetings from Pakistan! This is 41-year-old Iftikhar, from Lahore city. He is married, with five children. All his children attend the school in the morning and tuition class in the evening.

He has been making concrete slabs for many years.  He makes slabs in different sizes for various purposes, such as for roofs, floors, and to cover graves. 

He describes his efforts and procedures for making concrete blocks. He prepares a mixture of cement, sand, gypsum,and water and fills it under triangular frames to give a specific shape. He has been doing this work with fondness and spirit because its turnover is high. 

Nowadays, he has gotten a huge contract for making slabs from a builder, but he does not have enough money to buy the raw material he needs. This is why he has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy the raw materials. 

With the support of the lenders he will be able to complete the contract, which will cause an increase in his savings as well. He wants to provide his children with higher education and intends to save the profit for educational expenses in the future. 

Iftikhar is very thankful to the Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy gypsum, cement, and sand for making slabs to sell.

loans.name: Wangninnou Yves

texts.fr: Wangninnou Yves âgé de 33 ans, est marié à une marchande nommée Denise. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Wangninnou Yves a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau primaire. Wangninnou Yves vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les différentes de la famille sont supportées par Wangninnou Yves et sa femme. Depuis une dizaine d'année, Wangninnou Yves est un meunier. Wangninnou Yves exerce cette activité à son domicile, ce qui lui permet de faire face à ses diverses charges. Dans le but de renforcer ses prestations, par l'acquisition de pièces de rechange, Wangninnou Yves sollicite pour la sixième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Wangninnou Yves, 33, is married to a merchant named Denise. The couple has four children, some of whom attend school and all of whom are in their care. Wangninnou Yves went to school until elementary school. Wangninnou Yves lives with his wife and children. The household expenses are split by the couple. Wangninnou Yves has been a miller for about ten years. Wangninnou Yves does this at home, which allows him to meet his various responsibilities. In the goal of reinforcing his funds by acquiring spare parts, Wangninnou Yves is seeking for the sixth time financial support from ALIDé. The previous loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Ma.luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is married, with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Luisa is 56 years old, and her two children are in school.

Ma. Luisa has a motorcycle-repair business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new equipment for her shop.

Ma. Luisa has been in her business for 16 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her shop.

loans.name: David Luis

texts.es:
David es un hombre de 26 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, David no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, David se dedica a la agricultura, el ha arrendado una pequeña parcela donde siembra tuna, el trabaja todos los días en ella y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
David se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá los gastos de abono y riego de su cultivo, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
David is a 26 year old single man.  He lives in the city of Nazca with his parents and siblings.  He is a very enthusiastic hard-worker, who puts all of his effort into getting ahead.  Sadly, due to lack of financial resources and the need to work, David was not able to study for a professional career.

On his own initiative, David devotes himself to agriculture.  He has rented a small parcel of land where he grows prickly pear.  He works every day on his crop, and he is able to do so for approximately ten hours.  He likes doing his work, and he believes that it is going well for him because of his dedication and effort.

David is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help provided, he will cover the expenses for fertilizer and watering his crop.  This way he will continue working and putting forth effort in order to achieve his big dream of having his own agricultural plot of land.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and watering his crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more goods, such as sugar, soap, salt, soda, and beer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand and improve her place and to buy supplies for making food.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her loan was also helpful for the education of her child. For additional income, she also has an apartment for rent.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better; more items to sell will result in better profits. The profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Juanita hopes to have a grocery store someday and dreams of owning a vehicle. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week so that she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda, 33, is married with three children and runs a general store in her community as an aid to her husband's income from farming, which is their main source of income. She joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a loan to purchase additional canned goods and more grocery items for selling. She always find ways to earn an income to provide for the needs of her children in school. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and more grocery items for selling

location.town: San Pedro Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Presentation

texts.en:
Presentation is a 52-year-old married woman and mother of two children. She has been engaged in a farming business for more than ten years now. She lives with her family in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol.

Presentation is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her yield and profits. 

In the future, Presentation hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: 6 De Agosto Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 6 DE AGOSTO está  compuesto por ocho integrantes todas mujeres, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Elena tiene 23 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo,  es promotora de productos de belleza ella vende de manera ambulante visitando instituciones públicas y privadas, barrios distintos domicilios ofreciendo sus productos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Elena va a usar este préstamo  para comprar cosméticos que se encuentran en promoción para tener en stock para su  negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es tener variedad de productos para  satisfacer a sus  clientes, la Sra. Elena enfrenta retos en su negocio que son atender  con eficiencia a sus clientes y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y salir adelante  sola y en muchos de los casos sus compañeras de grupo también sacan adelante a su familia solas.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurship bank 6 de Agosto is made of eight members, all women. 

The president of the bank is Elena, who is 23 years old. She earns her living selling cosmetics through a catalog. She is a promoter of beauty products and is a traveling salesperson, visiting public and private institutions, various neighborhoods and homes offering her products.

This loan is her first sequence with the institution. Elena will use this loan to buy cosmetics on promotion to have in stock for her business. 

Her reason for asking for this loan is to have a variety of products to satisfy her clients. Elena faces challenges in her business, which are serving her clients efficiently. 

She will use the benefits to improve her family's quality of life. This is the only activity which allows her to maintain and move forward alone. In many cases, her companions in the group are also supporting their families alone.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics that are on promotion.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
This is Merlinda. She previously obtained a PHP 8,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in meeting her personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 10,000 loan to buy more groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profis. 

Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Merlinda dreams that her business will keep on flourishing and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and businesses every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 45 years old, from the Kvareli district, and lives with his retired father. Alex runs an agricultural business. He cultivates the plot of land where maize and watermelons are grown. He also has a vineyard and picks grapes in the fall. His products are high-quality and are easily sold at the local open market. Alex works hard, but his earnings are seasonal and without a monthly income it’s very hard for him to take care for his elderly father who has chronic health problems and often needs various kinds of medicines.

In order to generate more income, Alex decided to purchase a secondhand car to use as a taxi. He will transport the passengers from his district to the capital city in return for a service fee. The local people mainly use a taxi service to connect to the capital city and Alex’s service will be in high demand. A loan of 2,000 GEL will help him to start this taxi business. Alex is a very enthusiastic person and hopes he will earn a good income. He hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase a car and use it as a taxi

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a fish vendor from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married and the mother of two children. 

Antonia has been in the business for more than 16 years now. This is the source of her income.  She is asking a loan to buy more fish to sell. With this, she will be able to buy more fish that she can then sell to the people in her place. 

In the future, Antonia hopes to make her fish-vending business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Manuel con su anterior credikiva, en su tienda de ranchos víveres y  productos de la canasta familiar en general. Con su credikiva logró surtir su negocio y genera una mayor utilidad. Desde que recibió su crédito, como Manuel ha visto su negocio avanzar en posibilidades de ventas, está radiante, por su gran satisfacción; él dice a sus financiadores  “Gracias por su confianza y por apoyarnos económicamente, para poco a poco salir adelante“.  Hoy  Manuel está aplicando nuevamente a un credikiva,con el comprará productos de aseo personal, articulos para el hogar y víveres, pues considera que a su negocio  siempre hay que estarle invirtiendo, por la rápida rotación de estos productos y es que eso es,  lo que justamente hace de un credikiva toda una inversión de éxito.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Manuel with his earlier Kiva loan for his food and general family products store. With his Kiva loan, he was able to supply her business and and generate better profit. 

Since receiving his loan, Manuel has seen his business increase sales possibilities. He is aglow because of his great satisfaction. He says to his financiers: "Thank you for your confidence and for supporting us economically, to get ahead little by little."

Today, Manuel is applying again for a Kiva loan, which he will use to buy personal use products, items for the home and foods. He believes he must always be investing in his business for the rapid turnover of these products. This is what makes a Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy food, personal and household products in larger volume.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
María de 27 años, pudo cursar hasta cuarto grado de educación básica, esta acompañada y su pareja de vida se dedica a la actividades agrícolas y a trabajar como jornalero en  una granja de cerdos, que hay en el caserío; los tres hijos que tienen viven con ellos y actualmente, solo el mayor de los tres esta estudiando.


Ella, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, donde vende: golosinas, granos básicos, refrescos, entre otros. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace cuatro años, esta actividad  la desarrolla sin haber tenido quien le enseñara, dice que “ha aprendido en el camino”, anteriormente solo se dedicaba a las labores domesticas; pero la necesidad de llevar de alguna forma ingresos al hogar  la hizo tomar la decisión de iniciar el negocio. Ademas de vender en su casa, los fines de semana lleva a vender enchiladas, tostadas de plátano, agua en bolsa, refrescos a  la cancha de fútbol  del cantón, aprovechando  la gente que se acerca a ver los partidos que se realizan esos días.  En la casa atiende el negocio de lunes a viernes y algunas horas el fin de semana. Le ayuda una hermana y un hermano en el negocio.


Necesita el préstamo para surtir el negocio, necesita comprar mas productos, ella manifiesta que la pequeña inversión que ya tiene, no le da abasto para cubrir la gran demanda que hay en el cantón,.
Teniendo el crédito,  podrá aprovechar la oportunidad que ve  mediante el crecimiento y diversificación de la gama de productos que puede ofrecer a sus clientes , generándole  mayores ingresos  a ella y su familia.


Desea que su negocio sea productivo en el tiempo y que su familia pueda mantenerse de lo que genere esta actividad y que sus hijos puedan estudiar  y lograr graduarse de estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
María is 27 years old. She was able to attend grade school through the fourth grade. She lives with her life partner who works in agricultural activities and as a laborer on a pig farm that is in her village. They have three children who live with them and currently only the oldest of the three is in school.

She has a small store in her home where she sells sweets, basic grains, soft drinks, and more items. She has been working in this activity for four years. She learned this activity without anyone teaching her, saying that “she has learned it along the way.” Previously she worked doing domestic work, but the necessity of having some sort of household earnings made her make the decision to begin her business. Besides selling from her house, on the weekends she sells enchiladas, toasted bananas, water, and soft drinks at the canton’s soccer field, taking the opportunity as people come to see the games taking place those days. At home she tends to the business from Monday through Friday and some weekend hours. A sister and a brother help with the business.

She needs the loan in order to supply the business. She needs to buy more products. She said that the little investment she already has is not enough to cover the great demand there is in the canton.

Having the loan, she will be able to take the opportunity through growing and diversifying the range of products that she can offer her customers, generating more income for her and her family.

She wants her business to become more productive in time, for her family to be able to maintain themselves from what the activity brings in and for her children to study and graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy more products in order to diversify the products that she offers in the store.

loans.name: Madre Central Group

texts.es:
El comité Madre Central pasa al cuarto ciclo, todas las señoras se dedican a la cría de animales como gallinas y cerdos también venden huevos y quesos.  Son de una zona bastante alejada de la ciudad, y aun en crecimiento, sus ingresos son de actividades puramente rurales, pero sacrificadas.
Gloria también se dedica a la cría de animales y su venta o faena, ella comenta que es muy sacrificado el cuidar de animales, pero que ve como una opción para poder ayudar a su familia. Se destaca del grupo por ser una persona muy entusiasta y con ganas de salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, para poder seguir con su cría y también seguir luchando por su familia.
texts.en:
The Madre Central committee has passed the fourth cycle. All of the women in the group earn a living raising animals, such as chicken and pigs. They also sell eggs and cheese. 

They are in an area fairly far from the city, and although it is growing, their incomes are from completely rural activities, but self-sacrificing. 

Gloria also earns her living raising animals, and she sells or slaughters them. She says it is very self-sacrificing work taking care of animals, but it looks like an option for being able to help her family. She stands out in the group for being a very enthusiastic person with a desire to get ahead.

She is asking for this loan to invest in buying balanced feed for her animals, to be able to continue taking care of them and also continue fighting for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay laborers who she contracts to help her with the harvest.

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru: Зулайхо родилась в 1989 года. Она молодая и умная женщина. С целью того, чтобы обеспечить своих 2 детей со всеми необходимыми средствами, она начала свой бизнес производством пельменей 3 года назад. Она много практиковалась, прежде чем начать бизнес производством пельменей. Только тогда как она набрала достаточного опыта, она начала свой бизнес. Ее муж Эхсон является строителем. Ей введению бизнеса помогает брат ее мужа. Зулайхо имеет доброе сердце. Ее брат не имеет постоянное место работы. Он хочет уехать в Российскую Федерацию и найти там место работы. Зулайхо запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони, чтобы купить авиабилет для своего брата. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zulayhko was born in 1989. She is a smart young woman. In order to provide necessities for her two children she started her own business producing pelmeni (dumplings) three years ago.  She practiced a lot before she started her business producing pelmeni. Only when she gained enough experience did she start her business. Her husband Ehson is a construction worker. She helps introduce her husband's brother to businesses. Zulaykho has a good heart. Her brother doesn't have a permanent place of work. He wants to go to the Russian Federation and find a permanent job. Zulaykho is requesting a loan of the sum of 2000 Somoni, to purchase a plane ticket for her brother. She waits on your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To buy a plane ticket for her brother

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, 34, and is married, with three children. She manages her own piggery as an aid to her husband's income from employment. She has been making a living in this business for more than eight years. 

She joined GDMPC and got a loan to purchase feed, and piglets to raise.  In this way, she can expand her business and earn greater returns for the family. 

In the future, she wants to improve her business by expanding her pig shelter.

loans.use: to purchase feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support five children. She is married, and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Melanie requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp; she is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of an emergency.

Melanie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Orzigul

texts.ru: Женщина с прекрасной душой и прекрасными мыслями, которая живет на северной части Таджикистана, хочет организовать новый бизнес. Орзигулу 22 года. Она замужем, но не имеет детей. Ее муж Шухрат занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Орзигул  с целью того, чтобы организовать свой бизнес скотоводством, обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованной Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала на этом курсе и получила много позитива для себя. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Теперь она готова начать бизнес, однако она не имеет денег, чтобы купить скот. Скот она будет держать дома, где она имеет большой коровник. Она планирует купить скот, пересматривать несколько месяцев и перепродавать на местном рынке, а также она будет продавать молочные продукты. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  5000  сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
A woman with a beautiful soul and beautiful thoughts who lives in the northern part of Tajikistan wants to start a new business. Orzigul is 22 years old. She is married, but doesn't have children. Her husband Shuhrat works growing crops on a farm. 

In order to start her own business raising cattle, Orzigul took the course "To Get Ahead" organized by the Association of Business Women. She participated in the course and had many positive takeaways for herself. After completing the course, she received a certificate. 

Now she is ready to start her business, but doesn't have the money to buy cattle.  She plans to keep her cattle at home, where she has a large barn. she plans to buy cattle, raise them for several months and re-sell them in the local market. She will also sell their dairy products. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to purchase cattle. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start a new business

loans.name: Ma. Magna

texts.en:
Ma. Magna is a 51-year-old married woman, and the mother of five children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 30 years. This is their main source of income.

Ma. Magna is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and floaters. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Ma. Magna hope to make their fishing business a success, so that it will generate the income necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and floaters

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
This is Simplicia, 44, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Simplicia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Simplicia dreams that her business will expand, and hopes that her family will always be in good health.  She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is widow with one child; she runs a general store in their community to make a living. She has been in this business for more than eight years, and it runs smoothly, so that she earns enough for their needs. 

She recently joined GDMPC, and she got a loan to purchase additional goods to sell, like rice and feed. 

She is hopeful that her business will be successful, and she will be able to continue her dream of improving their own house for a comfortable living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell, like rice and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food items like tomato paste, juices, and soda

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy more fruits and vegetables for her business. Her income is a big help for their household's everyday expenditures. Aside from her fruits and vegetables business, she also has a variety store for additional income. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to purchase more fruits and vegetables needed in her business. She will also use the loan to buy grocery items for her variety store. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Guadalupe hopes that her business will continue to flourish, and dreams of having a better living. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business, and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy for more vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Jhed

texts.en:
Jhed is a young entrepreneur who runs a buy and sell business in his community to make a living. 

He buys coco lumber, coconuts, and, rice and sells it in volume. He uses his motorcycle in running this kind of business. 

Jhed joined GDMPC and got a loan to purchase spare parts and accessories for the motorcycle he uses in the business. 

His dream is to become a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and accessories for the motorcycle used in the business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 37 years old and married with six children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.  She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from tricycle transportation.

Gina has borrowed and paid ten loans from NWTF prior to this loan. 

Gina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Abdulmajid

texts.ru: Абдулмачиду 41 год. Он мясник и работает продавцом мясных продуктов на рынке города Куляб. Абдулмачид сам выращивает крупнорогатый скот для продажи мяса. Сейчас он обратился за кредитом для приобретения пару голов скота. Он надеется, что ему помогут в финансовом плане, и у него будет больше животных и тогда его деятельность будет процветать и увеличиться доход в семью Абдулмачида.
texts.en: Abdulmajid is 41 years old. He is a butcher and works selling meat products in the market in the town of Kulob.  Abdulmajid raises cattle himself, in order to sell meat. Now he has applied for a loan to obtain a pair of cattle. He hopes that he will receive support for his financial plan, so that he would have more animals, his business would prosper and it would increase his family's income.

loans.use: To buy a pair of cows

loans.name: Gbènassou Gilbert

texts.fr: Gbènassou Gilbert âgé de 48 ans, est marié à une marchande nommée Béatrice. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Gbènassou Gilbert a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau primaire. Gbènassou Gilbert vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les différentes de la famille sont supportées par Gbènassou Gilbert et sa femme. Gbènassou Gilbert est un meunier, qui exerce son activité depuis dix sept ans à son domicile. Cette activité lui procure des revenus l'aidant à répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le but de renforcer ses prestations par l'achat de pièces de rechange, Gbènassou Gilbert sollicite pour la sixième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Gbènassou Gilbert is 48 years old and married to a shopkeeper named Béatrice. The couple has four children, some of whom attend school and all of whom they support. Gbènassou Gilbert only received an elementary school education. He lives with his wife and children, and together they provide for their family's needs.

Gbènassou Gilbert is a miller who has operated his business for seventeen years from his home. His business produces earnings to help him provide for his family's needs. In order to expand the offerings for sale of replacement parts, he is requesting this sixth loan from ALIDé. His previous loans were all fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him.  He used the loan to buy more hogs and sacks of feeds.  He also used the loan for the education of his children.  His income from the business is a big help in his everyday expenses at home.  He is running this business for more than eight years and it continues to grow.  He continuously works to provide for his everyday needs.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy more pigs and sacks feed needed in his business.  His profits will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs and support the education of his children.  He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Nelson dreams that his business will stabilize and hopes that his children will finish studies.  He meets up with his co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more pigs and feed.

loans.name: Rafael Julian

texts.es:
Rafael es un hombre de ---, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos economicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Rafael no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Rafael trabaja como operario en una empresa avícola de su ciudad, adicionalmente tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de fruta, el trabaja todos los dias por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Rafael se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de frutas para abastecer a su negocio, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Rafael lives in the city of Cañete, in the Imperial district, with his wife and their two children. He is very hardworking, enthusiastic, and dedicates all his effort to helping his family get ahead. Unfortunately, due to lack of resources and the need to work, Rafael was not able to study a professional career.

Rafael works as an operator at a poultry farm in his city, and additionally has a small business selling fruit. He works every day for approximately 10 hours, and believes that his work is going well due to his dedication and effort. 

Rafael is very grateful to Kiva lenders, as thanks to their help he will be able to buy a greater quantity and variety of fruits to stock his business. With the help of this loan, he will continue working hard to achieve his dream of seeing his children study and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is a single entrepreneur farmer who is engaged in a gardening business selling vegetables in town for a living. She has been in this line of work for more than four years. She joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative recently and took out a loan to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides for her garden. She wants to become successful in her business and to be able to save a portion of her returns for future needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides for her garden

loans.name: Alexandre Vihanou

texts.fr: Alexandre Vihanou âgé de 37 ans, est marié à une coiffeuse nommée Rosalie. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Alexandre Vihanou a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Alexandre Vihanou vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les différentes de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Depuis quatorze ans, Alexandre Vihanou est un meunier. Parallèlement à cela, Alexandre Vihanou fait l’élevage des porcs qu'il revend ; ce qui lui permet de répondre aisément aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le but de renforcer son activité par l'acquisition de pièces de rechange, Alexandre Vihanou sollicite pour la sixième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Alexandre Vihanou is 37 years old and married to a hairdresser named Rosalie. The couple has four children, some of whom attend school and all of whom they support. Alexandre Vihanou went to school through secondary school level. He lives with his wife and children, and together he and his wife provide for the family's needs. 

Alexandre Vihanou has been a miller for fourteen years. In addition to this, he raises pigs to resell; together these allow him to provide for his family's needs. In order to further his business by purchasing replacement parts, Alexandre Vihanou is requesting this sixth loan from ALIDé. His previous loans were all fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa de 38 años,  estudio hasta cuarto grado de educación básica, esta casada y su esposo se dedica a realizar viajes, él es motorista. De sus cinco hijos solo el mas pequeño no estudia. Vive con ellos también una sobrina. 

Ella se dedica a la crianza de pollo de engorde, tiene este negocio desde hace 3 años, antes de dedicarse a este negocio, solo se limitaba a realizar los quehaceres del hogar. Pero antes, de casarse trabajaba en esta actividad con su mamá. Esta actividad productiva la tiene en su casa y le ayuda su hijo mayor en la alimentación y el cuido de las aves.


Necesita el crédito para comprar concentrado y el pie de cría (pollo de engorde), aprovechando la época navideña donde hay gran demanda de este producto y poder obtener de esta manera ingresos para su familia. 

Invirtiendo en esta actividad podrá aprovechar la oportunidad que se le presenta. No teniendo acceso al préstamo se le haría  muy difícil poder contar con este recurso.

Rosa  desea fortalecer su negocio y que este sea auto sostenible, que le garantice tener recursos para cubrir con las necesidades de su familia.  Sueña en un futuro, poder trabajar  en otras actividades productivas, como por ejemplo: crianza y engorde de cerdos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 38 years old, studied primary education through fourth grade. She is married and her husband works as a taxi driver. Of her five children, only the youngest is not in school. One of Rosa's nieces lives with her as well. 

Rosa works raising chickens, a business she has had for the past three years. Before starting this business, Rosa's activity was limited to household chores. However, before she was married, she raised chickens with her mother. Today, Rosa raises her chickens in her yard, and receives help from her oldest son who feeds and cares for the birds. 

Rosa needs this loan to buy concentrate and feed for the chickens, taking advantage of the Christmas season when there is great demand for her poultry. Doing so, she will obtain more income for her family. 

Being able to invest in her business at this moment will allow her to take advantage of the market opportunity. Without access to this loan, it would be very difficult for Rosa to find the money she needs to invest. 

Rosa hopes to strengthen her business so it becomes self-sustaining, which will guarantee that she always has the resources to cover her family's needs. She dreams that in the future she will be able to work in other activities as well, such as raising pigs.

loans.use: to buy concentrate and chicken feed, to take advantage of the Christmas season when there is great demand

loans.name: Señor De Huanca De Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Damiana ella es soltera y tiene 69 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 p.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frazadas, negocio de crianza de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These women belong to the communal banking group "SEÑOR DE HUANCA." This group is located in the city and district of Cusco, Peru. 

The borrower asking for this loan is Damiana. She is single, 69 years old, and has two children. Damiana has her own restaurant, where she prepares different meals such as chicken with potatoes, soups, and meat stir fries. She works from 10:00pm until 5:00pm. She has had this business for 7 years and it has been going very well, however her dream is to grow her business even further. Damiana is asking for this loan so she can buy products to cook such as chicken, meat and vegetables. 

The other members of this group work in businesses that include fruit sales, raising animals, convenience stores, and food preparation. 

Damiana is very grateful for all of those lenders who help her reach her dream through this loan. She promises to comply with all of her loan repayments according to the established repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy cooking products such as chicken, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Emprendamos El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EMPRENDAMOS EL FUTURO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Andrea ella es viuda y tiene 8 hijos; La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, leche entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con su negocio, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicandose a este negocio vendiendo sus productos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita él crédito para la compra de arroz y otros para su negocio.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, internet, negocio de restaurant, trabajadores de empresas privadas.

La socia que sale en la  foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank “EMPRENDAMOS EL FUTURO.” This group is located in the province and department of Cusco, Peru. 

The member asking for this loan in Andrea, who is a widow and has 8 children. Andrea works in a convenience store, selling basic goods such as rice and milk among others. Andrea is a very responsible person who is very entrepreneurial with her business. She has had this business for a long time, selling her products to her clients, and she wishes to continue working and supporting her family this way. 

Andrea is asking for this loan to buy rice and other products for her store. 

The other members of this group work in various industries, including handicrafts, internet cafes, restaurants, and stores. The member who appears to the side in this photo asked for permission to arrive late to this communal bank meeting for reasons related to her work. 

Andrea is very grateful for all those lenders that form part of her dream by helping her with this loan. She promises to comply with all loan repayments according to the timeframe established.

loans.use: to buy rice and other products for her business

loans.name: Roukaya

texts.en:
Roukaya is a 50-year-old married mother of six children. She has worked as a hair dresser, from her house, for the last 18 years. She works to help her husband make their living and cover their family's expenses. Her business is home based, because at the time, she can't afford to open a separate beauty salon outside her house. Also, she benefits from taking care of both her family and business at the same time.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's school fees and buy necessary newly released hair dying colors. This loan is very important for the development of her family's socioeconomic situation. She hopes to keep on working for her family and one day open a separate beauty salon, that will surely increase her family's income.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees and buy necessary newly released hair dying colors

loans.name: Evernice

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 26-year-old Evernice from Harare. She is married, with two children. She also cares for one other dependent. 

Evernice runs a retail business selling ladies' wear and formal wear for men. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenge she faces is competition from well-stocked rivals within the area. 

Evernice has requested a loan of USD 500 to buy more clothing items for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to look well after her family.

In the future Evernice plans to buy her own premises.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy her son's graduation suit, as he is about to graduate from school and she does not have the money for this expense

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to clean her fields and plant new coffee plants

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is 56 years old and married, from Jericho city. He lives with his wife and two sons in a very humble house in the city.  For the past two years, Sulaiman has been working in a small grocery store, where he sells grocery products that customers often demand. It is a good business and earns a good income.

Sulaiman took a USD loan from FATEN. This will help him to develop his store by applying more shelves and buying a small refrigerator.  By applying this loan, Sulaiman's income will be increased and also his family living conditions.

Sulaiman appears in the photo in his shop

loans.use: to develop his store by applying more shelves and buying a small refrigerator

loans.name: Las Flores De Baxil Group

texts.es:
