La señora Vicenta de estado civil casada. Cuenta con 44 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 4 hijos y ellos no estan estudiando. Ella tiene un miniriego y siembra maíz y frijol. Inició este negocio con un pequeño capital que tenia ahorrado y a la fecha lleva 12 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra invertir en la siembra de maíz y frijo, comprando semillas, pagando mano de obra, entre otras cosas. En el futuro desea tener mas tierras para poder cultivar por mayor el frijol francés.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de maíz y frijol.
texts.en:
Vicenta is married, 44 years old, and never had the opportunity to study. She has 4 children, none of whom are studying. She has a small plot of land on which she plants corn and beans. She began this business with some money she had saved, and has now been doing this for 12 years. 

Vicenta has organized this lending group and is now asking for a loan that she will use to buy more corn and beans, buying the seeds and paying for the labor to work the land. In the future, she would like to have more land to cultivate so she can grow beans in bulk. 

The other members of this lending group also grow corn and beans.

loans.use: plant corn and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate part of his coffee plantation

loans.name: Jimsher

texts.en:
Jimsher is from the village of Maghraani, Kakheti Region. He is 44 years old and married, with two grown children. Jimsher’s daughter is attending a university, and his son is jobless at the moment. Jimsher’s retired mother lives with him as well. 

The only one who is working in the household is Jimsher, who is employed at the local municipality and gets a monthly salary. In his free time, he serves his villagers as a taxi driver with his own car and transports them in the capital city. His earnings are hardly enough for covering daily expenses and his daughter’s required tuition fees.

That is why Jimsher decided to purchase thoroughbred milk cows and start a dairy business. He will keep the cattle in the shed located in his yard, and his wife will produce dairy products with the milk for selling as well as for family consuming. 

This loan will be a great support for Jimsher’s family, as it will generate income. Jimsher hopes for your kindness

loans.use: to start a dairy farm

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en:
Pastora is a married mother of three children from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in clothing sales for more than twenty years now. This is the source of her income.

Pastora is asking for a loan to buy more more stocks to sell like pants and shirts and blouses. With this, she will be able to sell more clothing  to the people in her location, thus augmenting her income. In the future, Pastora hopes to make her business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more more stocks to sell like pants and shirts and blouses

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is a married woman and a mother of four children. She lives with her family in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in a retail business selling various goods and commodities to the people in her city.

Manuela needs a loan for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, such as soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, canned goods and noodles, as well as cooking ingredients and seasonings. Through this, she will be able to augment her store thus allowing her to attract, and cater to, more buyers and customers.

In the future, Manuela hopes to make her business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell, such as soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, canned goods and noodles, and cooking ingredients and seasonings.

loans.name: Ghulam Rasool

texts.en:
Ghulam Rasool is a young and kind 26-year-old young man. He is married and the father of a son and daughter.

He is a very hardworking and loves his family very much. He has his own business to have a regular income in the family. He makes headdresses and garlands for grooms.  He started this business over five years ago. The headdresses are to be used for grooms and so are worn only for a single day, but the cost is high due to the expensive decoration on the headdresses. There is a lot of demand for headdresses and garlands because the marriage season is on peak at this time. He has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities.  

This seasonal business yields a good income for Ghulam Rasool. He wants to get extra profit during the marriage season and wants to offer more headdresses of various attractive designs. Now he wants to buy more raw materials for making headdresses and garlands in order to get extra profit. His family's needs are also increasing day by day and he needs to earn more money.  This is why he came to BRAC Pakistan and wishes to obtain a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan.  

He hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for his business as well as for his family. Ghulam Rasool says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy pearls, sequins, and imported silk cloth for making headdress and garlands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to develop his store by adding more shelves and buying more products to resell

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, which helped her to buy additional hogs and stocks of feed for her business. Her income from the loan helped her with the everyday expenses in her household. 
 
She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sofia dreams to have additional hogs and hopes that her family will have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad de 56 años, estudio hasta 6º grado de educación básica, es casado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus dos hijos viven en su casa, uno está acompañado y otro estudia. 

Él se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y a la ganadería, trabajo que aprendió a temprana edad. Antes se dedicaba al negocio ya que tenía una cantina.  Para realizar el trabajo de la agricultura, tiene el apoyo de su  hijo mayor y de su  esposa.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar una vaca, para obtener más leche y en el futuro venderla a mejor precio si se le da el cuido adecuado.

Su sueño, es que su  hija estudie una carrera académica en la universidad y sea una profesional. Las ganancias del crédito, le ayudan a darle a su hija para su estudio y pasajes para ir al instituto y poder cubrir los gastos del hogar,.

Él piensa sacar un crédito más grande, para comprar más ganado y cultivar mucho más y así su familia tenga un ingreso del cual puedan vivir bien.
texts.en:
Natividad is 56 years old, and has a basic education having studied through 6th grade. He is married and his wife dedicates herself to domestic activities. Their two children live with them at home, one is married and the other is studying. 

Natividad works growing basic grains and raising livestock, work that he learned at an early age. Before having this business he worked in a cantina. Now, his wife and his son help him with his agricultural work. 

The loan that he is asking for is to buy a cow, with which he will obtain more milk. In the future, he plans to sell the cow for a better price than that at which he acquired it. 

His dream is for his daughter to be able to study at the university and become a professional. With the income he earns from investing this loan, he iwll support his daughter's education expenses, as well as pay for transportation costs and other household expenses. 

Natividad is thinking of asking for an even bigger loan, in order to buy more livestock and cultivate much more grain, thereby increasing his family's income and allowing them to live well.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soda and beer for his store

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is a 23-year-old single lady, who works as a tutor from her parents house since 2011 to cover her needs and make sure that she can benefit from the chance of continuing her education which is her main aim at the present time. 

Aya is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for her university fees. Her business is doing well, but not well enough to cover the additional fees she needs.

She hopes that one day she can open a special tutoring center which will help her a lot in developing her living, and making her dream of educating people come true.

loans.use: To pay for her university fees

loans.name: Shokirjon

texts.en:
Shokirjon is 19 years old. He is a very clever boy. He graduated school with excellence and good marks. He was one of the best pupils of his school. He likes math, computer science, geography, and other subjects. His classmates like him very much. 

Three years ago he entered into the Pedagogical University of Tajikistan, in the Math and Computer Technology departments. His parents are poor people. Their income is too small to pay for Shokirjon’s study at the university. Shokirjon wants to be one of the best teachers in his town. He is purposeful and hardworking. He is asking for a loan to pay for his study at the university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is an 18-year-old single young man from Qalqilia city. He lives with his family in a very humble house in the city. Mohammad's father works as a teacher in a public school and he receives a low salary. One year ago, Mohammad opened a small shop for children's food and some grocery products.  He works in it to help his family with monthly expenses. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This will help him to develop his shop by buying more products and expanding his shop. By using this loan, Mohammad's income will be increased and also his family living conditions will improve. Mohammad appears in the photo in his shop

loans.use: to develop his shop by buying more products and expanding his shop.

loans.name: José Oscar

texts.es:
José de 58 años, no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que su madre nunca se intereso por el estudio, para ella eso no servia de nada. Él esta casado, tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales uno trabaja y los otros estudian. Su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. 

José es agricultor de toda su vida, a pesar que su madre nunca se intereso en ponerlo a que estudiara, ya que su padre los abandonos cuando el tenia apenas 2 años de vida. Si se esforzó a que él aprendiera un oficio y de una manera honrada, se ganara el sustento diario. Es así que José, inicio la aventura de ser agricultor junto a su madre y su hermano mayor, con quienes realizaba los trabajos de siembra, control de malezas y plagas, y la parte mas importante de todo el proceso de producción: la cosecha. Desde entonces, no a parado de trabajar en el campo y seguirá todos los días luchando para tener ingresos y ayudar a su familia. 

El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de materiales, ya que desea mejorar el techo de su vivienda, la cual se encuentra en malas condiciones a causa del deterioro ocasionado, por las tormentas de los inviernos pasados. A raíz de esto, José necesita comprar lamina para mejorar el techo de la vivienda. Lo cual le beneficiara, porque ya no existirán goteras dentro de la vivienda.

El sueño de José, es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, y para todo esto sabe que es necesario que continué trabajando y luchando como hasta hoy lo ha hecho, pero reconoce que no solo se centra en aspectos económicos, es por eso que dice, que la mejor herencia que él puede dejarles a sus hijos, es el estudio, ya que por medio de eso, ellos lograran superarse y ser mejores cada día.
texts.en:
Jose, 58, wasn't able to go to school because his mother didn't see the value in it; she thought it wasn't worth it. Jose is married and has three children, of whom one works and the others are in school. His wife takes care of the household.

Jose has been a farmer all his life, despite the fact that his mother never tried to put him in school. His father left when he was two years old. If he worked hard to have an honest career, he would be able to make a living. This is why Jose started a career in farming along with his mother and older sister. With them, he completed tasks of planting seeds, controlling weeds and infestations, and most importantly, completing the production process of harvesting. Since then, he hasn't stopped working in the field and has continued working to earn income for his family.

This loan will be used to buy materials to improve his home, which is in bad condition due to deterioration from storms in the past winter. For this reason, Jose needs to buy laminate to improve the roof of his home so it no longer leaks.

Jose's dream is to improve his family's quality of life. This is why he has to keep working and fighting as he has been doing. However, he recognizes that there are more than just economic factors, which are why he says that the best inheritance that he can give his children is an education. With this, they will succeed and improve every day.

loans.use: to buy laminate to improve the roof of his home.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience, 34, is a single mother of two. She lives in her mother's home with her siblings and children. She works hard every day to improve her income and to be able to have a better quality of life. Patience's job is selling sauce pans, rice cookers, and blenders. 

She has been working in this trade for 9 years, working alone and earning well. She alternates this trade with the sale of piped water. 
For now, she is continuing to work in the sale of sauce pans, rice cookers, blenders, etc. and she likes what she does. She ensures that she keeps customers that she has earned over the passing of time. 

This is her seventh loan with ID-Ghana, a Kiva partner, thanks to whom she has been offered the opportunity to access finances that offer her the security to continue with her work. On the other hand, she is committed to fulfilling her repayments in a punctual manner. With the requested amount of 1,600 GHS she will primarily buy sauce pans, rice cookers, blenders, and other items to sell to customers.

loans.use: to buy sauce pans, rice cookers, blenders and other items to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz is 59 years old. He is married and the father of two children. 

Mubariz is a very positive man.  He is a market vendor with 17 years' experience in his business. He sells different kind of goods like shampoo, flour, beverages, macaroni, butter, and candies. His business allows him to make his living and cover his living expenses. Mubariz is a man with a very good reputation in his area. 

Mubariz is requesting his first loan of AZN 1,500. He will use his loan funds to enhance his business merchandise with special-offer products and to diversify their products in order to satisfy the requirements of his customers, thus increasing his income.

He is investing much hope in this current loan, and he is hopeful that it will fulfill his customers' needs.

loans.use: to enhance his business merchandise with special-offer products

loans.name: Hafeez Ullah

texts.en:
Hafeez Ullah is a hardworking and zealous young man. He is 30 years old and lives with his children and parents in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Hafeez Ullah wants to continue to establish his general store as he has been doing with the help of first loan. He is very inspired from Kiva's field partner’s procedure. so he requested another loan. He wishes to convert this general store into a utility store. Until his dreams come true, he wants to buy fully dependent upon Kiva support. He is moving towards his goal step by step and he believes that his destination is not too far.

He requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he could expand the area of his general sore and place more sacks of inventory. He hopes that he will make sufficient saving from the profit amount that he will be successful in making his dream come true.

Hafeez Ullah says thanks to Kiva and hopes that the lenders will support him in his dreams.

loans.use: to expand the area of his general store.

loans.name: Thin

texts.en:
Thin is a 41-year-old woman with two school-aged children. They live with her and her spouse in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She practices agriculture, primarily growing rice and cassavas on her own farmland. Upon harvest, she collects her crops and sells to local traders or into the market of the province. 

She has been in this type of this business for more than fifteen years and with the proceeds she has been able to pay for her daily living costs, including meals, education, commodities costs, etc. Like most farmers, she is faced with challenges of price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes.

At the moment, she is taking out a loan in the sum of  4,000,000 KHR (Camobia Riels)  to prepare the land, hire laborers to weed her plantation, and buy seedlings for growing cassavas. Through her perseverance and hard work, she hopes to have an abundant harvest and sell it for a good price this year. 

Her dream is to be successful in her current business and make a stable income to provide enough for her family.

loans.use: to prepare the land, hire laborers to weed her plantation, and buy seedlings for growing cassavas

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is a 23-year-old, single young man from Jenin city. He lives with his parents and brothers in a simple house. His father is a farmer; he works in his own land with a seasonal income. Murad is a student in his last year in the university. He studies Business Administration. His father can't pay the university installments for him.

Murad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By applying for this loan, Murad will be able to complete his studies and find a good job in the future to help his family. 

Murad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a 20-year-old single young lady from Qalqilia city. She lives with her parents and four brothers in a simple house. Her father and brother are workers with very low wages. Ola is a student in her second year in the university. She studies Business Administration. Her father can't pay the university installments for her.

Ola took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By applying for this loan, Ola will be able to complete her studies and find a good job in the future to help her family. 

Ola appears in this photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad  is 49 years old and married with two sons.   He earns a living by breeding cows and cattle, and sells their milk and milk products as well as meat to local butchers. He has fifteen years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him how to look after cattle. 

Murad usually buys small cows, raises and fattens them for five or six months, and resells them for a more profitable price to butchers. Milk and yogurt he sells to neighbors. He earns about 180 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) a month, in part because milk, yogurt, and meat are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma, and always use yogurt. Milk products are seen as very healthy and used daily. 

Murad is requesting a loan of 600 AZN to buy two milk cows. This will be his first loan. He has a good client history and  plans to use the additional income he earns to care for his family.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 44-year-old married man from Gaza city. He lives with his wife and three kids, two boys and one daughter, in a simple house in the city. Mahmoud works as an employee in a local firm and he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Mahmoud has some health issues in his kidneys. This has prevented him from doing his daily work recently. 

Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him pay the costs of doing an urgent surgery for his kidneys. By applying for this loan, Mahmoud will be able go back to work and live a normal life. 

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the costs of doing an urgent surgery for his kidneys

loans.name: Shafa

texts.en:
Shafa is 34 year old and is a mother of 3 beautiful girls. She is a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has 6 years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person in this field. 

Shafa usually sells her crop to the market vendors in her area. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in the Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch. Her monthly income is 100 AZN. Raising crops takes a lot of strength, in addition to working in the open air. This is very hard work, which is why her daughters helps her. 

She needs additional money to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and increase her monthly turnover. For this purpose, she has applied for 1500 AZN. This is going to be her first  loan.

loans.use: to invest in seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 20-year-old single man, who has worked in selling fresh chicken for the last year and a half. Ali is responsible for the five members of his family which is why he puts so much effort to developing his business. He wants to make sure that his expected income will definitely cover his family's needs and requests.

Ali is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to develop his shop by putting in a special glass display, buying a refrigerator, and painting the shop to keep it more attracting to his customers.

Ali hopes to keep on developing and expanding his shop to make sure that he'll be capable of responding to the increasing number of customer requests.

loans.use: to develop his shop through putting in a special glass display, buying a refrigerator, and painting the shop

loans.name: Achiribo 4 Group

texts.fr: ACHIRIBO 4 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, nommée Élisabeth (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 41 ans. Élisabeth n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Élisabeth est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de François. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Élisabeth vit avec ses enfants. Les charges de ménage sont supportées par Élisabeth et son mari. Pour ce faire, Élisabeth vend des tissus et des habits de façon ambulante depuis quinze ans. Élisabeth s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Élisabeth s’associe aux autres membres du groupe ACHIRIBO 4 pour solliciter un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Achiribo 4 Group is made up of three women who live in the same village. The group's leader, Élisabeth (the woman with her hand raised in the photo), is 41 years old. She did not attend school. Élisabeth is married to a driver named François. The couple has two children, both of them in school. 

Élisabeth lives with her children; she and her husband manage the household expenses. In order to do so, Élisabeth has been selling fabric and clothing door-to-door for 15 years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of strengthening her business, Élisabeth has joined the other members of Achiribo 4 Group to seek a second loan from Alidé. The previous loan has been properly repaid.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and clothing.

loans.name: Ghulam  Sakina

texts.en:
Ghulam Sakina, age 57, deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (such as baby goats) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income.

She needs to improve her business, to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000. She will use the loan to purchase two more goats. She is in her second loan cycle, with a good repayment history. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is 49 years old. She lives with her school-age son and her grown daughter in the Khelvachauri district. Her daughter is a nurse at the local hospital and gets a monthly salary. Svetlana has a vocational education in medicine and has been running a pharmacy with her business partner for nearly three years.

To provide more income for the family, Svetlana decided to start her own pharmacy in a hired commercial space. The Start Up program, created by Kiva and Credo, enabled Svetlana to get a loan of 3,000 USD and start her business. With the received loan, she will purchase medicines, baby food products, and other products, and sell with a price mark-up. Svetlana hopes that the project will be profitable because there is not any other drugstore nearby. Svetlana is a very enthusiastic woman, with a great desire to provide her children with better living conditions. This loan will be a great support for the family, as Svetlana will be able to generate an income and improve the standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to start up a pharmacy

loans.name: Nakry

texts.en: Nakry is 47 years old and is a married woman of three children. She sells breakfast in front of her house, located in the Preah Sihanouk province, to make an income to add to her husband’s income. Her husband operates a service-based business providing Tuk Tuk service to the people living in their area. This year Nakry’s youngest child just graduated from high school and Nakry wants him to attend o a university in the province. However, she doesn’t have enough money to support him, so she decided to have a loan of 400 US dollars to enroll her son in the first-year program of a bachelor's degree. He is majoring is Korean literacy because he realizes that this will bring him a good job in the future as the market of Korean investment in Cambodia is increasing. Narky, pictured here, is applying for a loan to pay for her child’s education fees. The student is not pictured, but will be the beneficiary of the loan, though not directly responsible for paying back the principal.

loans.use: to enroll her son in the first-year program of a bachelor's degree.

loans.name: Gulsan

texts.en:
Gulsan is 48 years old, married, and the mother of three kids. When she was 13, she started to learn to work in agriculture. Her parents were the ones who taught her to grow fruits and vegetables, since it was their only source of income. She has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than ten years now. She sells her crops in the central bazaar to make profits in order to support her family.

Gulsan’s income from her business is 150 AZN. In order to increase the living conditions of her family, she plans to expand her business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. She believes in the near future, her sons will help her to expand the business. Since the vegetable and fruits business is a profitable and fun business, she wants the business to continue and prosper. Gulsen needs 1,500 AZN loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and fruit trees. Her biggest wish is to offer her children an education so that they can have good careers and help their family. This is going to be her first loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and fruit trees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items to sell at her store, like milk, biscuits, soda, chicken stock, and beer

loans.name: Josué Elmer

texts.es:
Josué de 24 años,  es un joven que estudio hasta 4º grado, está acompañado; su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus hijos viven con él  y aun no  están en edad para estudiar

Él se dedica a vender pan en una motocicleta, trabaja desde hace 3 años. El préstamo que está solicitando, es para reparar la motocicleta, ya que necesita repuestos, llantas nuevas mejorar la canasta donde amarra el pan y reparar el techo de su casa.

Su deseo, es que sus hijos estudien ya que el no tuvo la oportunidad, poder construir una casa digna y mejor para que su familia este mejor y más segura
texts.en:
Josué is a 24-year-old young man who was only able to stay in school until the 4th grade.  He is married and his wife stays at home rather than work.  Their children live with him and haven't yet reached the age to go to school

He works selling bread using his motorcycle and has been doing it for 3 years.  The loan that he is asking for is to repair his motorcycle which needs new parts and new tires, improve the basket that he uses to tie up his bread, and repair the roof of his house.

His dream is to put his children through school, since he didn't have the opportunity to do so.  He also wants to build a proper house so his family can be better off and safer.

loans.use: repair his motorcycle which needs new parts and new tires, improve the basket that he uses to tie up his bread, and repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Yunior Rafael

texts.es:
Yunior es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Yunior no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Yunior trabaja como chófer de taxi brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Yunior se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará un colchón para su hogar, ya que actualmente sus hermanos comparten una misma cama por falta de colchón, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su empresa de transporte.
texts.en:
Yunior is a 21-year-old single man who lives in the city of Ica with his parents and siblings.  He is very hardworking and enthusiastic.  He puts all his efforts into progressing and moving forward in life.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial means and having to work, Yunior wasn't able to study so as to obtain a professional career.

Through his own efforts, Yunior works as a taxi driver offering transportation services in his city.  He works every day for about 10 hours a day.  He believes that it is going well for him due to his dedication and effort that he puts into it.

Yunior is thankful for Kiva loans because thanks to this help he will be able to buy a mattress for his home.  Currently, his siblings all share the same bed because they don't have another mattress.

He will continue to work so as to realize his great dream of having his own transportation business.

loans.use: buy a mattress.

loans.name: Bahruz

texts.en:
Bahruz is 30 years old, married and has one son. He is a hardworking person who takes care of his family by doing business in animal husbandry. 

Bahruz raises cattle to sell meat. He has been in this business for five years. His wife supports him in the business. The business takes a lot of effort, but together they run it successfully. He sells the meat in the central bazaar where the demand for meat is high. People in Azerbaijan consume plenty of meat because it is used in most dishes. Some traditional meals like kebabs, dolma and others require beef in their preparation. His profit is 130 AZN monthly. 

Bahruz  is applying for his first loan of 1500 AZN in order to expand the business by buying new calves. He plans to raise these calves, fatten them, and sell more meat for the coming traditional holidays, when the demand for beef will increase. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to expand the business by buying new calves

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is 30 years old and a vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for the past 8 years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons. The loan will allow her to stitch up more clothes without delay. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Taj

texts.en: Taj is a 55-year-old married woman. She deals in the business of selling milk with the support of her son.  She has 2 cows and 3 buffaloes that make milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors and by this time, she has become famous in her community for providing good-quality milk. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. Her business is good enough to give her a decent life. She has six children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she requested a loan of 25,000  PKR to purchase another cow. It will help her to inflate her sales which ultimately help in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Resan

texts.en:
Resan is a 51-year-old married man, who lives in the village of Ortabatumi. He lives with his retired parents, two married and grown sons, and a granddaughter. One of his daughters-in-law works as a nurse at the nursery school, and his sons are artisans. They get monthly salaries. Resan runs a small-scale agricultural business. In particular, he owns a citrus garden, and four beehives with bee colonies.  Resan and his family members work hard all day long to earn their living, but their existing income is not enough to cover food and the everyday expenses of such a large family. That is why Resan decided to start his own business.

All of the financial institutions rejected his loan requests, because of his unstable financial condition and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Resan applied for credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of a Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva. This program enables the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $5000 will help him to purchase a minibus. He will work on the minibus line, transporting passengers from his village to Batumi city. The new business initiative will significantly increase the family funds. With the increased income, he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family members.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and work on the minibus line

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education.  She, along with her husband, has been doing the work of agriculture for many years. She raises different vegetables and fruits and sells them in the local market. Her husband assists her in growing various crops by watering soil for good quality production. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Shahnaz applied a loan of 30,000 PKR. This will help her to grow more crops, which ultimately helps in generating more cash. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 31-year-old, married woman. Her husband is employed in a small factory, but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. Four years ago, she started her business of sewing clothes to contribute to her family's income. She is familiar with stitching techniques and took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of buttons, needles and ribbons. With these supplies she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of buttons, needles and ribbons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: repair his truck, which he uses on his coffee farm.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is a 43-year old married woman and a mother of seven children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation and she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Sayada Zahida

texts.en: Sayada Zahida is 46-year old married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for six years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her best providing services she has become very famous in her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetic products for the parlor.  But due to low cash in hand she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. She needs a loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hoping to cater to more customers time after time. She dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Meraj

texts.en: Meraj is a 35-year old married woman; she has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals such as baby goats & calves at low prices, brings them up and sells them out near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation; currently she requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to purchase two more calves. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members through all of her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 57 years old and the mother of two kids. Fatma is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Agdas IDP Settlement. She has had her own agricultural business for fifteen years, already. She has built a greenhouse on a small piece of land, and she is growing vegetables. When her crops are ready, she goes out and sells them in the different markets located near her home. In Azerbaijan, there is a daily demand for fruits and vegetables because of traditional meals.

She needs a loan 1000 AZN, which she will use to buy mineral fertilizers. With these she will treat her soil and get a good harvest. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, in order to treat her soil and get a good harvest

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a 25-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She is running a business of hand embroidery in her community and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over 4 years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required materials. Today she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. Now she has requested another loan worth 20,000 PKR to purchase more spools of threads along with the packs of beads and sequins. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Nazia has taken up.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads along with packs of beads and sequins.

loans.name: Zaibun

texts.en:
Zaibun, age 37, is a married woman and a mother of two. She works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for the past 12 years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. Before she started earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole bread earner of the family. Due to limited resources, none of their children were sent to school. She felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. That’s when her sister advised her to borrow from Kashf Foundation. 

She has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR and her loan will be used to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in various colors. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata es una mujer de 59 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su hijo y nietos, ella es madres soltera, trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Fortunata no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Fortunata se dedica a la agricultura, ella tiene una pequeña parcela donde siembra uva, en ella puede trabajar todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Fortunata se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva,ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá los gastos de abono y riego de su cultivo, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de mantener a su familia unida.
texts.en:
Fortunata is a 50-year-old woman who lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona, with her son and grandsons.  She is a hard-working and enthusiastic single mother, who devotes herself wholly to getting her family ahead.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Fortunata was not able to study a professional career.

On her own initiative, Fortunata makes a living in agriculture.  She has a small plot of land where she grows grapes and on which she works every day for approximately 10 hours.  She believes it is going well because of her dedication and effort.

Fortunata is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they offered she will cover the cost of fertilizer and irrigation for her crops.  Thus she will continue working and striving to achieve her big dream of keeping her family together.

loans.use: to cover the cost of fertilizer and irrigation for her crops.

loans.name: Maqsoodan

texts.en:
Maqsoodan is a 33-year-old, vigorous, married woman, and a mother of four children. She has been involved in the work of hand embroidery for a year. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 20,000. She will use this loan to buy spools of thread in various colors, and packs of beads, sequins and stones, for embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income, by targeting more customers. She dreams of her children's bright and prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in various colors, and packs of beads, sequins and stones, for embellishment.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is a 38-year-old, married woman and a mother of three children. She has been running a business selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling quality clothes in her community. Ghazala requested a loan of PKR 50,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy different clothes for the winter season. By taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers, she would be able to achieve greater sales. 

She is in her seventh loan cycle and has exhibited strong repayment behavior. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes to resell for the winter season.

loans.name: Asghari

texts.en:
Asghari is a 45-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Asghari’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now the vehicle requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Asghari has applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for the vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers. Asghari is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Yasmean

texts.en:
Yasmean is a 30-year-old married woman.  She is a vigorous lady and for the past two years has been running a business of cloth sales.   She buys cloths of different fabrics and in various colors and designs from the wholesale market, and then sells them to the people of her community.   She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

She is requesting a 25,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs, in order to attract more customers and expand her inventory.   She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.  She is in her 2nd loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Gunay

texts.en: Gunay is a 28-year-old, young married woman who takes care of her two small kids. Gunay is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family   in the Agdas IDP Settlement. She is a Jabrayili refugee. She has land but she does not have enough funds to a cultivate the land or grow fruit trees or vegetables. For that she needs a loan 1,500 AZN to buy fruit trees, seeds, and fertilizers. Gunay awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fruit trees, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en:
Zahid is a 49-year-old married man with two children. After several attempts to find a job, he decided to start his own business. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last ten years. He breeds cattle too.

He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made from vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on ever Azerbaijan family’s table and are also used to make fresh punch.

Zahid sells his crops in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise the crops.

As his products are in high demand,  Zahid wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers. This is going to be his first loan.

loans.use: to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demands

loans.name: Evenor Antonio

texts.es: El señor Evenor continua con la construccion en su vivienda, ya que para el es muy importante mejorar sus condiciones de vida por el bien de su familia, con el credito anterior repellar y poner una parte de ceramica en la sala de su casa, con este credito pondra ceramica en la parte de la cocina y pintara la casa, el labora para una empresa privada como conducto y recibe el apoyo de sus hijos ya mayores de edad, su esposa ama de casa le apoya incondiconalmente, agradece la confianza que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado
texts.en:
Evenor continues with the construction of his house, since to him it is very important that he improve his living conditions for the sake of his family.  With his previous loan, he was able to plaster and partially tile the living room of his house.

With this loan, he will tile part of his kitchen and paint the house.

He works for a private company as a driver and is supported by his wife and children.  His wife is a house wife and supports him unconditionally.  He is grateful for the trust that Kiva and Afodenic have shown towards him.

loans.use: buy construction materials.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana, 29, is single and lives with her parents, brother, sister-in-law, niece and nephew. Diana’s sister-in-law works as a cook at a hotel and gets a monthly salary. The family rents the first floor of their house and generates a small-sized income.

In order to be employed and earn funds, Diana decided to start up a grocery store near her house but found she didn’t have enough money to do so. Unfortunately, Diana was unable to obtain a loan from existing financial institutions, as they required business experience and stable income as a precondition to a loan. But Diana has now received her loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides start-up and re-startup loans with easy terms to the vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit products. With a loan of 2,000 USD Diana will purchase stock of basic groceries to start a store. She will work as a salesperson herself and serve her clients in a friendly way. 

Diana is very determined young lady who wishes to help her family members. She hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to start up a grocery store

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба родилась в 1959 года. Она заботливая мать 2 детей. Махбуба замужем. Она всегда старается для благополучия своей семьи. Махбуба всегда старается к новшеству. Несмотря на свой возраст, она хочет организовать свой бизнес, так как она сохранила себя хорошо и имеет крепкое здоровье. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей детских одежд. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых женщин. Махбуба имеет огромное желание организовать бизнес и очень нуждается финансовой поддержки. Махбуба запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки детской одежды. Она нуждается вашей поддержки и ждет ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mahbuba was born in 1959.  She is married, and is a caring mother with 2 children.  She always puts her family first, and does what she can for their benefit. In spite of her age, she remains hale and hearty, and always seeks to try out new things.  She hopes to start her own business dealing in children's clothing; to this end, she has taken a course organized by an association for businesswomen titled "Attain Success".  Mahbuba wants nothing more than to get her business up and running, but she lacks the money to do so.  As such, she is requesting a loan of 3000 somoni to stock up on children's clothes.  She needs your help, and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: buy children's clothes for starting a new business

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 33-year-old, married woman. She has been doing a business of selling milk, for the past 10 years. She has one buffalo in milk; she sells the milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to help her lead a decent life. She is mother of four children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life, with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life.

This is her second year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of Kashf. Nasreen  has requested a loan of Rs 20,000. She will use the loan to purchase one more buffalo, and feed for its calves. She hopes to get an increase in the milk-production capacity, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah is a 29-year-old, married man and has four children. He lives in a poor area in Sana'a, Yemen. He is a guard by profession, working more than nine hours a day in a company. He is a very ambitious man whose dream is to raise his children well. Inadequate capital and inflation mean he may not achieve his children's demands. He intends to buy some things for his house so he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy furniture to use for his house. He hopes to buy a retail shop and a car in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy furniture to use for his house.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 27-year-old married woman. For many years she has been running a business of selling the animals she purchases. She buys animals, such as baby goats and calves, at low prices, raises them and then sells them for the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). She also sells milk to generate an extra income. To improve her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase one more calf. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase one more calf to raise.

loans.name: Muath

texts.en:
Muath is a 30-year-old man. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has a barber store which has been operating for a few years. He started his business with just enough capital to qualify him to open his business. He has some regular customers and is quite preferred in his zone because he always strives to offer his customers good service. He would like to expand his business to increase his profit.

He requested a second loan from AMB. With this loan, he’ll buy barber supplies to attract more customers. In the future, he hopes his family will attain better living conditions and that he’ll be able to maintain his business. He thanks Kiva lenders for funding his first loan.

loans.use: to buy barber supplies.

loans.name: Saif

texts.en:
Saif is a hard-working, responsible and happy man. He lives with his child, in Sana`a, Yemen. He works to earn the income needed to support his family.  He has been operating a shop to repair fridges. First, he learned the skills for this career at a technical institute, and then he was able to establish his business. He is able to attract many customers, because he is a professional in his business.

He needs to secure the source of income to support him and his family. It is for this reason that he requests a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. The loan will allow him to buy electrician's equipment for repairing fridges. He hopes to be successful and improve his living standard.

loans.use: to buy electrician's equipment for repairing fridges.

loans.name: Meleyke

texts.en: Meleyke is 36 years old.  She lost her husband 2 months ago.  Now she is the only person who can take care of her family.  As you can see from the photo, she has land but she does not have enough funds to a cultivate the land or grow fruit trees or vegetables.  For that, she needs a loan of 1,000 AZN to buy fruit trees, seeds and fertilizers.  This is going to be her first loan.  Meleyke awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fruit trees, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She, along with her husband (the man shown in the picture), have been making shoe uppers for the past many years. She supplies these uppers to different factories where they are used in making shoes. She is very experienced in her business and is confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of a loan. 

Bashiran has requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy additional material to make shoes including leather, artificial leather, and plastic soles. She is currently in her third loan cycle with the Kashf Foundation and has exhibited good repayment behavior. She wishes to expand her business and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional material to make shoes including leather, artificial leather and plastic soles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like ladies' dresses, men's suits and jeans

loans.name: Ghulam  Sakina

texts.en:
Ghulam Sakina is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of three children.  She has been running a business selling milk.  Ghulam Sakina initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time.  With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income.  Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination.  Because of her work, she is respected in her home.  She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters.  

While talking to the Kashf officer, Ghulam Sakina shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies.  She has some savings and applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase another buffalo.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  She is in her 6th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 23-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She runs a small general store in her community along with her husband (the man shown in the picture) for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers over the years who regularly shop at her store. She and her husband make enough to provide for their family's daily household needs. 

To fully stock their store, Naseem has requested a loan for Rs 25,000 which she and her husband will use to buy rice, sugar and flour at lower rates from the market. In this way they will be able to consistently meet the increasing demands of their customers. They wish to utilize part of their revenues to increase the business's capital and the remaining amount to meet their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
Kareem is a 33-year-old married woman.  She has been involved in selling milk to the people of her community for about five years.  She has one cow and three buffaloes.  She sells their milk, along with butter and cheese that she makes from their milk, to many of her neighbors.  

She is a mother of two and needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. She requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy one more buffalo to improve her ability to generate income. The additional buffalo will help her to improve her sales which will ultimately help to generate more income for her.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en:
Tengiz, age 57, is from the city of Kutaisi, the capital of the western part of Georgia. He is married and has one underage son. Tengiz operates a bread bakery in which traditional Georgian bread is baked. Tengiz's wife works as a baker there and their family earns a small monthly income.

To improve their earnings, the family decided to start another bakery in their yard to bake pies and cookies. They've already built the building but need additional funds to purchase pastry-making equipment. Tengiz hopes his project will be profitable as he lives on a crowded street and similar bakeries are not located nearby. 

He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase pastry-making equipment.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 48-year-old married woman. She has sold animals for the past eight years. She buys animals, such as baby goats and heifers, at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She currently has two buffaloes and four heifers. She makes enough through her business to contribute to her family's income. She also sells milk to generate an extra income. 

Zubaida has two children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing. She needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. For this reason, she has contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase two more heifers. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan she wishes to expand her business and grow her income.

loans.use: to purchase two more heifers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more medicine like panadol, syrup and others for the pharmacy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more medicine for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en: Anwar is a 23-year-old single man who lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. He is a university student. He has been an ice cream seller for the last three years. He started his business by selling ice cream at home. He had no choice but to work and provide his family with food and clothing. Al-Hodeidah Governorate is one of the warmest cities in Yemen and therefore, most of the residents buy ice cream daily. This business allows him to meet his family's needs without much difficulty. Now, he wants to start selling ice creams in new quarters and places in his city. This is why he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy ice cream to expand his business. He hopes to expand his business to generate more profit.

loans.use: to buy ice cream to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more medicine for her pharmacy

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar, age 36, is from the village of Vakijvari where she lives with her husband and two school-age sons. She is actively involved in an agricultural business and runs a dairy farm with one milk cow. Tamar produces cheese with the received milk for selling as well as for family consumption. In addition, Tamar and her husband-David grow nuts and maize on family-owned land and sell the harvest seasonally. David works as a watchman at the local fish farm and gets a small monthly salary (approximately $120).

In order to meet her increasing family expenses, Tamar decided to start her own business. Tamar has noticed a high demand for used clothing in the market as local people can’t afford to buy new clothing due to their poverty. In response to the local market demand, she has requested a loan to purchase stock of used clothing to sell among her community members with a price mark-up. She plans to invest the profit in the same business and develop it in the future. Tamar hopes this loan will change her life.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, tea leaves, rice, tomato paste, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nonvignon 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement NONVIGNON 2 est composé de huit personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de  Olive Colette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo.  Olive Colette est âgée de 41 ans et vit au Bénin.  Olive Colette a arrêté l’école au cours primaire.  Olive Colette est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Anges. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge.  Olive Colette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille,  Olive Colette vend des tissus et divers articles de merceries à son domicile. Olive Colette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu,  Olive Colette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement NONVIGNON 2, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Nonvignon 2 Group is made up of eight people who all live in the same neighbourhood.  This is the fourth time that they have had a loan from the field partner, Alidé.  They have requested the loan in order to improve the size of their businesses.  

The group representative is Olive Colette, she has her hand raised in the photo.  Olive Colette is 41 years old and lives in Bénin.  She stopped attending school during the primary years.  She is married to Anges, a driver, and they have five children who all attend school.  Olive Colette lives with her husband and children, and together they provide for the financial needs of their household.  To do this, Olive Colette sells fabric and other haberdashery items from her home.  She buys her supplies at a market in Bénin.  In order to increase the size of her business, and the level of her earnings, Olive Colette, and the other members of the Nonvignon 2 Group, are requesting this fourth loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to buy fabric and haberdashery items.

loans.name: Sheedan

texts.en: Sheedan is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of six. She has been running a business selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. Sheedan requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through more sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy different clothes to sell for the winter season.

loans.name: Twivanemubukene Group

texts.en: Anastasie is 43 years old. She is married with six children. Her husband works in a private company.  Anastasie is a group leader of a group called Twivanemubukene in Kinyarwanda meaning, “get out of poverty,” in English , the group members believe in working hard to change their mindset and also investing much effort to have a better future. She sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for the past six years. with the loan, she will buy bananas and fish to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children. In the picture, Anastasie holds a blue registrar book.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and fish to sell

loans.name: Narek

texts.en: Narek is a young private entrepreneur from Yerevan. He lives with his parents, brother and sister-in-law. Narek's father is a construction worker and his sister-in-law is a nurse. Narek runs a technical equipment store where he sells a variety of high-demand items. His brother helps him in organizing and running his small business. All the family works hard to earn a living. Narek's business currently needs some investment in order for it to function in a sustainable way. A loan of USD 3,000 will help him greatly by enabling him to purchase new items to sell in his store. The loan will make the small store more compatible. Narek and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and will highly appreciate their help in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase new items to sell in his store

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 43 years old and she lives in West Point. She is single and has seven children between the ages of 8 and 23 years old. All of her children are attending school. For the past 10 years, she been frying and selling doughnuts. She always feels bad because she has many customers but limited commodities. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, flour, sugar, etc. for her business. She hopes to have her own shop and expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, flour, sugar, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Vahan

texts.en: Vahan is an experienced farmer from Tsaghkunq village of Armavir region. He lives with his wife, daughter, son, and elderly mother. To be able to take care of his family Vahan is engaged in breeding livestock such as cows, piglets, and hens and cultivates tomatos, greens and alfalfa. Vahan's family members help him greatly in his activities related to farming; Vahan's son helps him sell the agricultural products in the local market. In order to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Vahan needs a loan of USD 2,500 to purchase wheat seeds, fertilizer, forage for his livestock, harvesting services and to make previous credit repayments. He has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it back. However, thanks to his hard work recently, Vahan was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Vahan and his family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for the harvesting services and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: L'union De Senzidor Group

texts.fr:
Denis est le coordinateur de son groupe L`Union de Senzidor. Il habite dans la région nord d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Il a dirigé son commerce de vente de produit divers durant les 5 dernières années. Il a 2 enfants. Avant de commencer ce commerce, Il etait un enseignant Denis voudrait utiliser cet emprunt dans l'achat des cosmetiques, vetement, chaussures.

Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce. Des autres membres de l`union de senzidor ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vente de produits alimentaires et cosmétiques et charbon. Denis dit que son défi principal il n y a pas des acheteurs constants et vente credit qui lui rend difícil. Il dit que son rêve c`est d`avoir un plus grand grand dans Esperanza pour obtenir un plus grand commere.
texts.en:
Denis is the co-ordinator of the "Union de Senzidor" Group.  He lives in the north of Haïti where electricity supplies are rare and water supplies are very limited.  He has operated a sales business for the past 5 years, and has 2 children.  Before working in sales, he was a teacher.  He will use his loan to buy cosmetics, clothes and shoes for resale.  Denis hopes that this loan will help him to increase the size of his business.  

The other members of the "Union de Senzidor" Group will use their loans to help with their food, cosmetics and charcoal businesses.  

Denis says that his biggest challenge is finding loyal customers, and selling on credit makes it difficult to run his business.  His dream is to work with the field partner Esperanza to develop a larger business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items likes beans, dagga fish, etc.

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en: Knarik is an experienced agronomist from Goravan village of Ararat region. She lives with her husband and three sons. Knarik's husband works in the private sector, but his salary is so low that he cannot meet the family's needs based on that salary. All the family is engaged in the cultivation of wheat, tomato, peach and apricot. Knarik's husband and sons sell their agricultural products at the local market. Agribusiness are an important source of income for the family. In order to continue farming activities, Knarik needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase wheat seeds, pay for the harvesting services, pay for the workforce, buy fuel for agricultural machinery, and make previous credit repayments. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to the hard work recently, Knarik was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Knarik and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds, harvesting services, labourers, to buy fuel for agricultural machinery, and previous credit repayments

loans.name: Gisenyi Twizamure Cb Group

texts.en: Violette is married and she has three children. She is a group leader for the group called Twizamure in Kinyarwanda, which means “uplift each other” in English. The group members sell different items and they have been in the business for the past two years. Violette sells different items such as soaps, sugar and lotions and has requested the loan to add more items to sell. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more soaps, sugar and lotions to sell

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre muy trabajador, para poder salir adelante labora como agente de seguridad en una pequeña empresa de su ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y dedicado.

Jorge está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales para realizar mejoras en la pequeña habitación donde vive ya que presenta varias grietas, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Jorge is a very hardworking man. To be able to get ahead, he works as a security officer at a small company in his city. He works about nine hours a day and thinks that he does well in his job because he is responsible and dedicated. 

Jorge is grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to buy materials to make improvements to the small room where he lives, which is beginning to show some cracks. In this way he will be able to improve his quality of life and continue to fight to realize his great dream: "To have his own house."

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Buena Voluntad Group

texts.es: El grupo lo forman tres socios emprendedores exitosos uno de ellos es Cristina  mujer de 39 años de edad, soltera, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de Avon y zelsa desde hace 1 año. El crédito lo está requiriendo  para la compra de productos como perfumes de varón, perfumes de damas, lociones, boddy, maquillaje, desodorantes, cremas faciales, cremas corporales, etc. Yerry tiene la edad de 22 años su negocio es la venta de calzado y Eva tiene la edad de 33 años su negocio es la elaboración y venta de fajas de cuero.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three successfull entrepreneurs, one of whom is Cristina, 39, who is single and has been selling Avon cosmetics for a year.  She needs the loan to buy products such as men's and women's perfumes, body lotions, makeup, deodorant, face creams, etc.

Yerry, 22, sells shoes and Eva, 33, makes and sells leather belts.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's perfumes, body lotions, makeup, deodorant, face creams, etc.

loans.name: Natali Lucia Elvira

texts.es:
Natali es una joven de 22 años, la cual trabaja como obrera en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, con lo cual tiene un ingreso para poder sacar adelante a su pequeño  de 5 años.

Natali esta agradecida con el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a esta ayuda podrá comprar plástico, maderas, entre otros materiales para poder reforzar el techo de su vivienda, ya que actualmente es de esteras y de esta manera podrá proteger su vivienda de la lluvia, así mejorara su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesion a su hijo y una buena calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Natali, 22, has a job as a hired worker on a farm in her city.  She earns a living this way to provide for her five-year-old son.

Natali is grateful for the support from Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy plastic, wood and other materials to reinforce the roof of her home, currently made of matting.  This will allow her to protect the home from the rain, improving her quality of life so she can continue working toward her goal of "Giving her son a profession and a quality lifestyle".

loans.use: To buy materials such as wood, plastic and others.

loans.name: Arcadio Jose
