Being a hard-working mother, Josephine engages in buying and selling fruits and vegetables in her community to supplement her husband's income and help meet their everyday needs. She aims to make her business profitable in order to generate sufficient income and satisfy her family's needs. 

Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for PHP 5,000 to buy a bigger number of eggplants, beans, tomatoes, papaya, bananas, and cabbages to sell.

Through hard work and strong determination, she is hoping that someday she will make more improvement to her business.

loans.use: to buy more eggplants, beans, tomatoes, papaya, bananas, and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
La joven Mirna es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es una Pulpería que tiene desde hace 8 años.
Mirna tiene su negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como arroz, azúcar, manteca, café, pan agua, refrescos, harinas, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. 
Mirna con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario y con esta ayuda espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia. 
Mirna espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia.



Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre  del  2013
texts.en:
Mirna is a very hard working and responsible young woman. She lives in community in southern Honduras with her family. Her business is a general store that she has had for 8 years. 
 
Mirna's business is located in her house in the town where she lives. She needs the loan to buy more products such as rice, sugar, lard, coffee, bread, water, beverages, flour, etc. to keep doing her work. It brings in a big portion of her income. 

With the loan, Mirna hopes to increase her sales. This will be very useful to her since she doesn't have the products she needs to cover the orders from her customers every day. With this help, she hopes to improve her and her family's quality of life.  
 
In the short term, Mirna hopes to grow her business and thus keep supporting her family. 



Choluteca, Honduras – September, 2013

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, lard, coffee, bread, water, beverages, flour, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jomar

texts.en:
Jomar is 33 years old and still single. He operates a motorcycle transport business in his community to earn his daily income. 

Jomar is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy gasoline, spare parts, and accessories needed to maintain his motorcycle. In the future, he hopes to earn and save more money to support his parents and save for his future. Through patience and hard work, Jomar believes that he will able to improve his family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts, and accessories to maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Durán.  Empezó con el negocio de la venta de bebidas tiempo atrás, por la necesidad de aportar en su hogar para todos los gastos.  Trabaja sola durante el día, vendiendo desde su casa.  No es casada, pero tiene hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad y no viven con ella.  Desea a futuro poder comprar otro congelador para su negocio.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de cuadernos y útiles para sus nietos que están estudiando.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Durán.  She started with her business of selling drinks some time ago out of the necessity to contribute to all of the household expenses.  She works alone during the day, selling from her house.

She is not married, but she has children who are now adults and do not live with her.

In the future she wishes to be able to buy another freezer.  She now needs the loan to buy notebooks and other school supplies for her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy notebooks.

loans.name: Putri Sari Group

texts.en:
Evaluated after the last loan, the Putri Sari receive their new loans with increasing loan size.  Ni Made and four other members decided to increase their loan from 1.5 million IDR to 2 million IDR because they plan to purchase pigs to prepare them to become sows. Ni Made also purchased a pig that is set to become a sow. Her sow is now already old and needs to be sold soon. The price for the pig is about 1.5 million IDR and the rest of the loan will be used to buy feed.

To increase the income, Ni Made and her husband also breed chickens in their backyard. They hope all the businesses run as planned and they can earn more profit, have more success and be happier.

loans.use: to purchase a pig and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme mariée de 30ans à un maintenancier informatique et à un enfant de 7ans scolarisé.  Elle est revendeuse de pagnes et de vêtements cousus à tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle sollicite son prêt auprès de WAGES pour acheter et revendre des pagnes puis épargner.  Elle veut surtout augmenter la taille de son activité et assurer l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en: Ablavi is a 30-year-old woman, married to a computer maintenance technician, and with a 7-year-old child who attends school.  She sells pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and other hand-made clothes from her shop.  She has requested this loan from WAGES (Women and Associations for Gain both Economic and Social) in order to buy pagnes for resale and to save.  She would really like to increase the size of her business and provide for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy new stock for her shop.

loans.name: Dioleen

texts.en:
Dioleen is 41 years old and a mother of two. She owns and manages a small restaurant and variety store located within her local community. 

Dioleen is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy fresh meat, vegetables, fish, seasonings, and various grocery items to cook and sell. She hopes to improve her business to make it more profitable in order to generate a higher income for her family. Dioleen believes that her loan will enable her sustain and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fresh meat, vegetables, fish, seasonings, and various grocery items to cook and sell at her food stall

location.town: Brgy. San Geronimo, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina works hard to support her family. Filipina is married, and she has a business buying and selling vegetable and spices in the Philippines.

Filipina has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of vegetables and spices to sell.  She has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 37 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. For the past two years, Michelle has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as rice.

Michelle is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of goods to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, and other products. In the future, she would like to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, and other products

loans.name: Mavaega

texts.en:
Mavaega is 28 years old, married, and has three children. She has a small lawn mowing business, which she has been doing for five years. 

Mavaega is requesting a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy a new lawn mower, oil, petrol, and safety boots. She will use her profits to improve her family's standard of living and expand her business. Mavaega joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase a new lawn mower, oil, petrol, and safety boots

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano es padre de 3 hijos, casado. De oficio Agricultor y comerciante. Dedicado al cultivo de maíz, trigo y frijoles, el cual lo ha cultivado con mucho esfuerzo y empeño. Se siente agradecido con Kiva y Micrédito porque gracias a su anterior crédito aumento sus ingresos con respecto a la venta de sus cultivos. Solicita nuevamente un crédito para comprar frijoles al por mayor y revenderlo a otras ciudades, con el fin de obtener mas clientes y satisfacer sus necesidades. Estima que con este crédito aumentara sus ventas y tendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Feliciano is married and the father of 3 children.  He farms and operates a small business.  He grows maize, wheat and beans, work that requires much hard work and persistence.  He says that he is grateful to Kiva and Micredito because their past loans have helped him to increase the income he earns from his crops.  He is applying for a new loan that he will use to buy wholesale supplies of beans that he will resell in other cities.  The investment will help him meet demand and pick up new customers.  The loan, he says, will increase his sales and bring in bigger profits.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies of beans.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
El  señor Elias tiene 59 años de edad, es casado tiene una  hija,  por quien se ha esforzado mucho para sacarla adelante. El señor Elias tiene una despensa y ventas de pescado, tiene local propio, y vive en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
Se inició teniendo solo unos cuantos productos, pero después con mucho trabajo fue creciendo y mejorando su negocio. Hoy día ya tiene muy buena clientela que viene creciendo y mejorando cada vez más.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, comestibles, verduras, panificados y demás, con lo que podrá seguir creciendo y mejorando cada vez más.
texts.en:
Elías, 59, is married with one daughter for whom he strives much to move forward.  Elías has a grocery store and also sells fish.  He has his own locale and he lives in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.

He started out with just a few products but with much work gradually grew and improved the business.  Today, his clientele is large and continues to grow and improve more every time.

He’s requesting this loan to buy beverages, food items, vegetables, baked goods, etc. to continue growing and improving more every day.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Evelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Evelia tiene 49 años, está casada, ella tiene una chipería en su casa, en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Las chipas son alimentos típicos paraguayos, y que cada día está mejorando cada vez más, ya que sus productos son muy ricos.
Ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y es por eso que pide de este crédito, para poder comprar almidón, y seguir haciendo las chipas para la venta. Evelia es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que con su esfuerzo y sacrificio viene trabajando.
texts.en:
Evelia is forty-nine years old and is married.  She has a cheesy bread bakery in her home.  She works in her bakery every day, beginning at a very early hour.  These cheesy breads are a very typical Paraguayan food.  She improves her breads a little bit more every day; her breads are very delicious.

She wants to continue investing in her business.  For this reason, she is asking for a loan that she will use to buy corn starch.  This will allow her to continue making and selling cheesy breads.  

Evelia is a very hardworking and enterprising woman.  She continues to work with a lot of determination and sacrifice.

loans.use: to buy corn starch to make cheesy bread.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formo con la unión de 20 vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Caacupé, es por eso que lleva por nombre “Las Amigas”. Vieron una gran oportunidad de crecer por medio del programa de la fundación paraguaya, y están luchando por mejorar.
Una integrante es la Sra. Deisy, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, ella vende chipas, un alimento típico paraguayo, y cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que la chipa se vende bien sin importar que haga frío o calor. Cuenta que le costó al principio montar su emprendimiento, pero que hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de chipas para la venta, para que así siga con su trabajo y luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
This group was formed as a result of 20 neighbors and friends from the city of Caacupé joining together, which is the reason why the name of their group is “Las Amigas” (The Friends).  They saw the program with Fundación Paraguaya and thought it would be a great opportunity to grow and strive for improvement.

One of the members is Sra. Deisy, who is the president of the group.  She sells “chipas” (cheese bread), a traditional Paraguayan snack, and is doing very well.  “Chipas” sell very well despite the weather being hot or cold.  She was able to cover the initial startup costs of her business and now she has a very good clientele.

Deisy is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of “chipas” to sell.  This will enable her to continue her work and strive for improvement.

loans.use: to buy cheese bread to sell.

loans.name: Cheikh Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur CHEIKH est un homme qui habite aux environs du guichet .Il est âgé de 40ans, il est marié et père de famille. Son activité consiste à vendre des tissus tels que les bazins, wax et autres. Il a ouvert une boutique dans le marché. Il a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce domaine.
Il sollicite un crédit de 100.000F CFA pour acheter des tissus et renforcer son stock de marchandise. Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de la famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. CHEIKH commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 13h le matin et le soir de 15h à 19h. Il  a comme projet futur d’ouvrir une autre boutique et cela grâce aux crédits de l'institution.
texts.en: Mr Cheikh is a man who lives in the vicinity of the field partner.  He is 40 years old, and married with children.  He sells fabric such as damask, wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and others.  He owns a shop in the market and has more than 10 years experience in this business.  Cheikh has requested a loan of 100,000 francs CFA to buy fabric to increase his stock levels.  He is responsible for the day-to-day expenses of his family and the costs of schooling for his children.  He works from 8am until 1pm, and then from 3pm until 7pm.  Cheikh's project for the future is to open another shop and he hopes to be able to do this with loans from the field partner.

loans.use: to buy fabric such as damask, wax pagnes, etc, for resale.

loans.name: Jonelyn

texts.en:
Jonelyn is 37 years old and has three school-age children. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she made a way to plant, harvest, and sell vegetables in their back yard. 

She aims to acquire additional vegetables to sell, but she does not have enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy seeds and fruits of bitter melon, beans, string beans, okra, sweet potatoes, and eggplant, to plant and sell in the market. 

She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to further improve her business as she continues to work hard and strives towards success.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fruits of bitter melon, beans, string beans, okra, sweet potatoes, and eggplant, to plant and sell in the market.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 48 years old and has six children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Julie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional feed.

Julie has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Julie would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed.

loans.name: Ekata

texts.en:
Ekata is a 30-year-old partnered woman with four children. She owns a small stall selling meat buns to the local community. 

Ekata has requested a loan to buy flour, garlic, onion, chicken, soy sauce, and gas. She joined SPBD in 2011. With her earnings, Ekata will help improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy flour, garlic, onion, chicken, soy sauce, and gas

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Adriana tiene tres hijos, todos mayores de edad y que ya son independiente, pero siempre la ayudan. Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir desde hace un tiempo, se inicio en el ramo de la venta ambulante debido a la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia ahora ya todos grandes y ella pudo lograr con su meta.
Ella siempre ha trabajado ya que sabe que esa es la única forma de salir adelante y por medio de un trabajo signo seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida. Adriana solicita de este préstamo para poder comprar jeans,  prendas para criaturas, prendas para damas etc. Agradece por la ayuda que esta recibiendo que le será de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
Adriana has three children.  They are all now independent adults but they help their mother.  Adriana has been making a living selling clothes for some time.  She started as a street vendor as she needed to help her family prosper.  With the children all gorwn up now, she has achieved this goal.

Adraian has always worked as she know that having a decent job is the only to get ahead and to continue improving her living conditions.  Adriana is applying for this loan in order to buy jeans, and clothes for women and children.  Adriana is grateful for this support as it will be very helpful for her.

loans.use: to buy jeans, and clothes for women and children.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
El Sr. Domingo tiene 29  años de edad, aun no tiene hijos, pero ya comprometido con la Srita. Liz de 26 años, ambos quieren casarse y poder llegar a forma una bella familia.
Domingo empezó con este trabajo desde el año 2009, en donde empezó con un capital propio que venía ahorrando por las horas cátedras que enseña en Universidades.
Tiene una distribuidora de hielo, que empezó comprando una pequeña máquina que le producía unos 50kg. Semanales de hielo en cubitos listo para su venta y como también por la venta de pollos en forma mínima.
Hoy día es bueno mencionar que gracias a los esfuerzos y sacrificio que puso está teniendo un buen mercado en casas de bebidas y patios de comidas dentro del casco urbano de la ciudad. Es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante y crecer.
Pide de este préstamo para la compra de una maquina fabricadora de hielo que hace más 6,6kg por hora, con lo que podrá expandirse y ganar mas clientes.
texts.en:
Domingo is 29 years old and does not yet have children.  He is engaged to Liz, who is 26 years old, and they both want to get married and form a beautiful family.

Domingo started started his work in 2009 when he used money that he made as a teaching assistant at the university.  He has an ice distribution center where he started by buying a small ice machine that made 50 kilograms a week of ice cubes ready to sell.  He also sometimes sold chickens on the side.  Today, thanks to his efforts and sacrifices that he made, he has a good market of drink shops and restaurants in the city.  He is a hardworking person who wants to succeed and grow.

He is requesting this loan to purchase an ice machine that makes 6.6 kilograms per hour, which will allow him to expand and gain more customers.

loans.use: to purchase an ice machine.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es: El señor Benito es soltero no tiene hijos , vive con su hermana, el señor Benito es de la provincia de Capinota del departamento de Cochabamba, uno de los lugares  pobres de Bolivia, vino al Trópico de su comunidad de Capinota, como la mayoría de las personas buscando mayor oportunidad de vida. En su comunidad de Capinota se dedicaba a la producción de maíz, bajo sus ingresos debido a los cambios climatológicos, fue difícil de controlar, cada vez la producción escaseo, por lo que decidió migrar  al trópico,  que se compró el terreno agrícola, en el que hoy en día trabaja en el sector agrícola y se dedica a la producción de yuca, de donde tiene en producción 1/2 hectárea de la cual cosecha un promedio de 450 quintales  lo que comercializa a los intermediarios que le vienen a comprar al lugar. El crédito que está solicitando el señor Benito es para mantenimiento de sus cultivos de yuca para así poder obtener un rendimiento mayor en su cosecha.
texts.en: Benito is single, has no children and lives with his sister. He is from the province of Capinota in the department of Cochabamba which is a poor area of Bolivia. He left his area of Capinota for the tropics like the majority of people looking for better opportunities in their lives. In Capinota he grew corn, but his income diminished due to climate change. It was difficult to control and he saw his output continue to decline, so he decided to migrate to the tropics.  There he bought farmland on which today he grows yuca.  He is farming 1/2 hectare and harvests an average of 450 quintals which he sells to middlemen who come to his place to buy. Benito is asking for a loan so that he can take care of his yuca crops and achieve a greater yield in his harvest.

loans.use: to care for his yuca crops

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn, who is 44 years old andd a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Romeo and the mother of their children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Jocelyn maintains a direct-selling business. She sells assorted soaps, coffee, vitamins, and juice.  A customer's order is paid for in cash by the dealer, and then the customer is given a one-month-to-pay credit. The prices dealers pay are lower than those in the catalogue, and the difference is the profits that dealers rely on as their income. Jocelyn's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy assorted soaps, coffee, vitamins, and juice.

Jocelyn dreams of being successful in her business and hopes to help her family financially. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of assorted soaps, coffee, vitamins, and juice.

loans.name: Rea

texts.en:
Rea is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rea is 38 years old and has three children who are in school. Rea has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. Rea has been in this business for 10 years.

Rea requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

 In the future, Rea would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Oralia Margarita

texts.es: Oralia, a sus 43 años de edad, se ha dedicado a trabajar en su propio negocio desde hace aproximadamente 15 años, una peluquería en la cual trabaja todos los días prestando servicios de corte, cepillado, químicos, manicure y pedicure, el local se encuentra ubicado al lado de su vivienda y los fines de semana cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana debido a la gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan el servicio en esos días. Adicionalmente alterna su trabajo de estilista con la venta de mercancía y productos por catálogo, con el fin de complementar los ingresos para ayudar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y velar por el bienestar de su hijo de 10 años de edad. La prestataria es una mujer activa, emprendedora y perseverante, lo que le ha permitido lograr los objetivos que se propone, esto la motiva a solicitar el crédito con el que comprará herramientas de trabajo (plancha, secador de cabello, cepillos, tijeras, entre otros) y mercancía al por mayor (perfumería, cosméticos, accesorios, entre otros), así podrá mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y prestará un mejor servicio a su clientela, además tendrá más variedad de artículos para la venta con lo que obtendrá mejor margen de ganancia, haciendo que sus ingresos familiares aumenten. De esta forma, Oralia desea continuar con su labor y trabajar con empeño y dedicación, para que en un futuro pueda cumplir el sueño de ampliar su sala de belleza e implementar nuevos servicios, dando como resultado una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en: Oralia, 43, has operated her own salon business for 15 years.  She works seven days a week, cutting and combing hair and providing manicures and pedicures.  She operates her shop in a space on one side of her house.  Her sister helps her on weekends because she now has more customers than she can take care of by herself.  Oralia also sells beauty products.  She buys the products from a catalog and sells them to her customers.  Her income, along with her husband's, supports the family's needs and ensures that they can provide for their 10-year old son.  The borrower is a hard-working and enterprising woman, characteristics that have allowed her to meet her goals up to now.  She is now applying for a loan that she will use to buy the equipment she needs--hair dryer, brushes, scissors and other equipment--to carry on her business.  She will also buy wholesale supplies of beauty products--perfume, cosmetics and others--that she will resell.  The investment will improve Oralia's business and allow her to deliver a better service to her customers.  The wider range of products will provide her with a larger profit margin and, in turn, increase the income she has to support her family.  Oralia wants to expand her salon and provide new services, something that will ultimately lead to a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies for her salon business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina works hard to support her family. Marina is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marina has been in this business for 11 years now.

Marina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like tempura, egg, vegetables, etc. 

In the future, Marina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like tempura, egg, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 35 years old and married with two children who are in school. Daisy works very hard to provide for them. Daisy runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Daisy has been in this business for 2 years.

Daisy requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Taiaopo

texts.en:
Taiaopo is a 21-year-old single woman with no children. She has a business venture, selling and making pancakes to the local community. 

Taiaopo has requested a loan to buy sugar, flour, baking soda, eggs and plastic bags. She joined SPBD in 2012. 

With her earnings, Taiaopo will help improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, baking soda, eggs and plastic bags.

loans.name: Rose De Viterbe

texts.fr: Rose est une femme de 50 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 15 et 21 ans. Elle a aussi 4 autres personnes à sa charge. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des batons de manioc dans un marché de la place depuis 10 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera acheter une parcelle d'un champ de manioc pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Rose is a 50-year-old, married woman with 4 children between the ages of 15 and 21.  In addition, she is financially responsible for 4 other people.  Rose has sold sticks of cassava at a street market for 10 years.  She has a good knowledge of her suppliers and her customers.  This knowledge has been built up over time due to her experience in this field.  

Unfortunately, she often runs out of stock because she must sell everything before she has enough money to buy further supplies due to the small size of her capital.  She would like to buy a portion of a cassava field to improve her stock levels, respond better to the demands of her customers and prevent her out-of-stock problems.  She will use her earnings to increase the size of her business and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a portion of a cassava field.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora, 29 years old, is married with two children. She lives in Dap-dap, Polanco with her family. She works on a farm to help her husband, who has earnings as a carpenter. Leonora plants corn and harvests coconut for a living. She joined GDMPC recently and borrowed to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the farm. She always finds ways to augment their living. 

In the future, Leonora wants her farm to be successful and wants to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support her family. Merlinda is married, and she has a business weaving "abaca" in the Philippines.

Merlinda has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional abaca to weave.

Merlinda has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more abaca to weave

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina works hard to support her family. Lorina is married and has a business weaving "abaca" in the Philippines.

Lorina has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional abaca fiber to weave.

Lorina has been in this business for 16 years now.

In the future, Lorina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional abaca fiber to weave

loans.name: Leticia Del Carmen

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Leticia en su confección,  porque con su credikiva pudo comprar telas, botones, pellón, entre otros. Con el credikiva los inventarios del negocio de Leticia se incrementaron y su imagen de negocio mejoró, lo mismo que el nivel de sus ingresos. Ella dice a sus financiadores “Gracias por su apoyo”, esto es porque se siente satisfecha,  debido a todo lo que ha logrado alcanzar poco apoco. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará una vez más, tela en un mayor volumen, y planea tener mucho éxito, porque fabricará para su clientela, en la temporada de mayor inversión en este tipo de productos.
texts.en: Thank you for helping Leticia with her sewing business.  She has used past Kiva loans to buy fabric, buttons and other supplies.  The loans helped Leticia grow and improve her business and, in turn, to increase her income.  Her message to lenders is: "Thanks for your support".  Past loans have allowed her to get ahead, little by little.  She is now applying for a new loan that she will use to buy new supplies of fabric, at wholesale, so that she can carry on the business.  This is the time of year when her customers spend the most for the clothing she makes and she wants to be ready to meet the demand.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies of fabric for her sewing business.

loans.name: Mareen

texts.fr: Mareen est une jeune femme de 31 ans mariée mère de famille . Elle est commerçante dans le domaine de la restauration depuis 5 ans. Grâce à son accueil chaleureux et à la bonne qualité des plats proposés,et surtout aux prix pratiqués, elle a acquis une clientèle considérable et de plus en plus exigente.La petitesse de son chiffre d' affaires ne lui permet plus de satisfaire les doléances variées de la clientele. en effet,ce crédit lui permettra d'augmenter son stock de denrées alimentaires (farine, palette de poisson et les fruits)les ingrédients)afin de diversifier et augmenter les quantités de ses denrées alimentaires entrant dans la composition de ses plats, de satisfaire sa clientèle mais aussi d'augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Mareen is a young woman, 31 years old, and a married mother with a family. She has worked in the restaurant domain for five years. Thanks to her warm hospitality and the good quality of the dishes she offers, in addition to her reasonable prices in particular, she has acquired a considerable customer base, which is more and more demanding. Her limited sales no longer allow her to address the various laments from her customers. So this loan will enable her to increase her stock of supplies (flour, fish, fruit) to diversify and augment the ingredients for making her dishes. Thus, she can satisfy her customers and also increase her profits. She will reinvest part of the profits in her business to expand it. The rest will help her to meet family needs.

loans.use: to increase her supplies (flour, fish, fruit) for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cinder blocks, sand, cement, iron, gravel and wood.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is very thankful for the previous financial assistance extended to her because she was able to buy school and office supplies to sell to her customers. Her loan also helped educate her children. The income generated by her business helped her pay everyday household expenses as well. She has been in her current business for 15 years.

She would like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy school and office supplies and products to sell in her business. More items to sell will result in a better profit, and this will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Anita dreams that her business will continue to grow and expand and she hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for school and office supplies and products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is married, with three children.  He is engaged in a business buying and selling dried fish in his community. 

He used a motorcycle in vending his dried fish with his wife. She used to sell twice a week in the adjacent community, traveling 20 to 30 kilometers in order to sell the product. He joined GDMPC and borrowed money to purchase additional dried fish to resell. 

He hopes to sustain his business and be able to own a stall in the market where he can sell his fish. 

He wants to improve the general living conditions of his family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is thankful for the prior financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products to sell in her variety store. Her loan also helped her educate her children. The income from her business assisted in paying everyday household expenditures as well. Her husband, who is an electrician, is helping her produce income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to sell. The more items displayed at the store the better her profits and the greater her ability to sustain her family’s daily needs and pay her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this loan with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Arlene hopes that her business will be stable and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study religion, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alleluya Group

texts.fr: La cliente Okadi est une présidente adjointe du collectif de crédit  « Alleluya», senior entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 52 ans  et mère de 7 enfants dont 2 étudient et d’autres ont déjà leurs foyers respectifs. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’Administration publique.  La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires.  Son siège de vente est à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le fonds additionnels du prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les denrées alimentaires (2 sacs de manioc, 1 panier de colocase, 3 régimes de bananes, 1 sac de maïs, etc.).  Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses 2 enfants et acheter une parcelle pour y construire les maisons de location. La vente en crédit et l’insécurité grandissante dans les zones rurales d’approvisionnement occupées par les rebelles et autres groupes armés négatifs  sont de défis pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Okadi, is a vice-president of the loan collective "Alleluya". She is a senior entrepreneur, experienced, energetic, 52 years old, and a mother of seven children, of whom two are students, while the others already have their own homes, respectively. Her husband is a public servant. This client sells food supplies. Her house is her main location. She started her business with her own funds from her husband. Later on, she benefited from additional funds from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for ten years. 

This new loan is going to be used to purchase food supplies: 2 sacks of cassava, a basket of taro, 3 bunches of bananas, a sack of corn, etc. Thus, she would like to provide education for her two children and to purchase a plot of land on which to build a house to rent out. Her main challenges for developing her business include selling on credit and the growing insecurity in rural supply areas occupied by rebels and other undesirable armed groups.  

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for promoting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs, especially at this critical time of war in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies (cassava, taro, bananas, corn, etc.)

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making nipa roofing in the Philippines.

Rosalinda has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing materials for her business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing materials for her business

loans.name: Fualulu

texts.en:
Fualulu is 29 years old and married, with six children. 

She has a small business providing taxi service (transportation) to the general public. She has more than five years' experience with this business.

Fualulu needs a loan to purchase new car tires and seat covers and pay a registration fee. 

She will use her profits to improve her family's standard of living and to expand her business. Fualulu joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new car tires and seat covers and pay a registration fee

loans.name: Antoni

texts.es: Antoni, tiene la edad  de 20 años, está casado y vive con su familia. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de unos  cerdos y el alimento del mismo. El cuenta con varios cerdos   y lo que pretende es aumentar sus animales  . El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de engorde  de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Antoni, 20, is married and lives with his family.  He plans to use this loan to buy some pigs and the supplies he needs to raise them.  He has several pigs now and wants to add to his stock.  When he fattens the pigs to their ideal weights, he will sell them in the local market or one nearby.  The investment will allow him to increase his income and better provide for his family.  This is Antoni's first FUDECOSUR loan.  He's never borrowed from an established bank before, but FUDECOSUR offers loans on good terms and relatively low interest rates.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Princisita

texts.en:
Princisita is 54 years old and married, with four children.  

Princisita is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer.

Princisita has been farming vegetable for three years now, and she has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en: Ricky is 33 years old and the father of one child. To make a living, he works in the local river digging sand and gravel to use for house construction. He also buys more of these materials to add to what he gathers. He has been doing this for more than three years to support his family. He joined GDMPC and is requesting a loan to buy additional sand and gravel to resell. He wants to improve his business and earn more income to meet future needs.

loans.use: to buy additional sand and gravel to resell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 39 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Marissa runs a business buying and selling charchoal (coconut shell) in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of coconut shells to make charcoal.

Marissa has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Marissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconut shells to make charcoal

loans.name: Mubeheza Group

texts.fr:
Angèle fait partie du groupe  Mubeheza  et  habite à Cibitoke.Elle est veuve. Elle a 7 enfants  qui étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de  viande de chèvres   depuis 18 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de chèvres pour vendre une grande quantité de viande , pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Angèle is part of the group Mubeheza and lives in Cibitoke. She is a widow and has seven children, who are student. 

Angèle has been doing commerce in goat meat for eighteen years. 

This is her first Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase many goats in order to sell a large quantity of meat, so as to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase many goats to sell a lot of meat, so as to earn more

loans.name: Eric

texts.fr: Eric est un jeune homme de 28 ans, célibataire sans enfants. il est commerçant dans un marché de la place où il vend la vaisselle et autres depuis 8 ans. Son activté fonctionne bien. il a juste un problème dû à la petitesse de bson capital qui l'oblige à faire écouler tout son stock pour pouvoir s'approvisionner à nouveau, d'ou les ruptures constantes de stock et l'insatisfaction de sa clientèle. ce crédit lui permettra non seulment d'augmenter ses ventes mais aussi son bénéfice. marge bénéficiaire qui sera réinvesti dans son activté pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en: Eric is a young man, 28 years old, unmarried, and without children. He is a merchant at a local market, where he has been selling dishes, bowls, basins, and other containers for eight years. His main business is going well. He just has a problem, meager capital, which compels him to sell his entire inventory in order to stock up again, thus the constant inventory shortages and the unhappy customers. This loan will enable him not only to increase his sales but also his profit margin. He will reinvest his profits in his business to expand it. The rest will allow him to support himself.

loans.use: to increase his stock of merchandise

loans.name: Тулкинчон

texts.ru: Тулкинджон живет в сельской местности. Он имеет большой опыт в сфере животноводство. Его отец занимался разведением скота и Тулкинджон с детство помогал отцу. У него был свой баран, за которым он должен был ухаживать. Как говорит сам Тулкинджон: «Тогда ухаживание за бараном был детским увлечением. Теперь разведении коров это мой доход и заработок на жизнь». Он вырос и пошёл по стопам отца. Поначалу ему было нелегко, особенно в зимнее время, когда вся земля было покрыто снегом  и приходилось тратить больше средств на корм скота. Но годами опыт доказывал своё и Тулкинчон стал находить пути решения препятствий и способы для лучшего продвижения своего дела. Теперь на сегодня он имеет 4 голов барана 2 коровы. Его жена также помогает ему. Тулкинджон также мастер - каменщик и штукатурщик. Подрабатывает дополнительно для проживания, обучение детей и ежедневные расходы. В связи с сезонностью он не может продавать своих баранов  сейчас и купить корм, так как цены на них упали. Тулкинджон нуждается в дополнительных средствах для дальнейшего корма скота и приобретения новых скотов. С этой целью он обратился в МДО «Арванд» за кредитом. Считает, что приобретённый кредит сможет устранить его трудности. Выражает благодарность «Кива» за содействие и огромную роль в его жизни.
texts.en: Tulkindjon lives in a rural area and has a great deal of experience raising livestock. His father was a cattle breeder and Tulkindjon helped him since he was a child, and had his own ram that he had to take care of. As Tulkindjon himself says, "At that time taking care of a ram was a childhood passion. Now, raising livestock is my means of making a living." He grew up and followed his father's footsteps. It wasn't easy at first, especially in the wintertime, when the earth was completely covered in snow and he had to put more resources toward feeding the animals. But through the years, experience proved itself and Tulkindjon started to find ways of solving problems for the best continuation of his business. Now he has four sheep and two cows, and his wife also helps him. Tulkindjon is also a craftsman - a bricklayer and plasterer. He makes extra money to cover housing, his children's education costs and everyday expenses. For seasonal reasons he can't sell his sheep right now and buy feed, since prices for them have fallen. Tulkindjon needs additional resources so that he can feed his animals and bring in new livestock. With this goal in mind he has turned to microfinance organization "Arvand" for a loan. He believes that the acquired loan will help to eliminate his difficulties. He conveys his thanks to Kiva for the assistance and its huge importance in his life.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and cattle

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is thankful for the previous financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store, which she has run for seven years now. Her loan also helped pay for the education of her children and everyday expenses. 

She has requested another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to sell in her store. The more items displayed at the store the higher her profit and the greater her ability to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Criselda dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Felix

texts.fr: Félix est un homme de 42 marié père de 7 enfants dont l'age varie 1 et 19 ans. cinq de ses enfants vont à l'école. Après sa formation, il a ouvert un atelier de menuiserie qu'il gère lui même depuis 6 mois dans un marché de la place. son activté fonctionne bien. Il a juste un problème dû à l'électrivcité qui tire chez le bailleur. Il aimerai avoir sa propre ligne et acheter les planches avec le reste. le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit sera réinvesti dans son activité pour  l'agrandir.
texts.en: Felix is a 42 year old man, who is married with seven children between the ages of one and 19. Five of his children go to school. After his apprenticeship, he opened a carpentry workshop that he has been running himself at the local marketplace for six months. His business is doing well. He just has a problem with the electricity that he receives from his landlord. He would like to have his own electricity line and he would like to buy planks with the rest of the loan. He would use the profit obtained from this credit to reinvest in his business to expand it.

loans.use: To obtain his own electricity supply and to buy planks.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina lives in Dap-dap, Polanco with her family. Her husband is employed as a private driver, and she manages their own farm to earn a living. 

Aside from farming, she also has a retail store to which she dedicates a lot of her time. Recently, Rosalina joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to purchase fertilizer for the farm. She is determined to improve the farm because it is their main source of income. She has saved a portion of her return for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
This is Priscilla, 57, who lives in Cabrera, Pasay, the Philippines, with her husband, a driver, and their children. They are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Priscilla maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular brands like Avon, Fuller, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. Dealer prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers earn as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 4,000 in sales every week.

To help continue her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise such as shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed by her customers.

Priscilla hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 64 years old and widowed with eight children. Virginia works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell such as soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, canned goods, and other items. Virginia has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from direct selling Avon and Natasha products.

Virginia aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, canned goods, and other items.

loans.name: Grisell Maria

texts.es: Grisell es una señora de 35 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Boaco, casada y madre de 2 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, dedicada con mucho empeño a la venta de ropa y zapatos nuevos. Inicia este negocio hace 5 años, lo que le ha generado buena clientela. Hoy en día cuenta con una tienda en donde ofrece una variedad de mercancía. Su meta próxima es ahorrar para ser autosuficiente. Solicita un crédito para comprar de mercadería nueva tales como: zapatos, cartera, ropa, joyas de aceros etc. Con el fin de aumentar aún más sus ventas y cumplir con las necesidades de sus  clientes. Estima que con el préstamo podrá comprar los productos nuevos y así suplir con la demanda de los clientes, además incrementara sus ganancias. Su plan futuro es extender su negocio y poner otra tienda en una localidad de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Grisell is a 35 year old woman who is a native of Boaco. She is married and mother to two children. She is a businessperson who with lots of determination sells new clothing and shoes. She started this business 5 years ago and has generated a good clientele. Today she has a store where she offers a variety of merchandise. Her next goal is to save in order to be self-sufficient. 

Grisell is requesting a loan to buy new merchandise such as shoes, purses, clothing, stainless steel jewellery etc. She wants to further increase her sales and fulfill the needs of her customers. She estimates that with the loan she can buy new products to supply her customers demands and increase her revenues. Her plan for the future is to expand her business and open up another store in the city.

loans.use: to buy shoes, purses, clothing, stainless steel jewellery etc.

loans.name: Kucup Mekar Group

texts.en:
Now the leader of the group, Ni Ketut, can attend the meetings. The Kucup Mekar group will use their new loan to support their pig business. 

Ni Ketut and her husband are hard workers, not only as farmers, but also as pig breeders. The loan will be used to purchase three piglets, each 300,000 IDR. The price for piglets and feed are very high right now. She needs to be very wise to manage the loan and run the business to get maximum profits. She hopes that during the loan period, the pigs will grow fast and fat, away from diseases. 

Ni Ketut and the members of Kucup Mekar hope that MUK will support the group until they have the capital to run the business by themselves. Two of the members could not attend this meeting because they had a religious ceremony at their house.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets.

loans.name: Sinoti

texts.en: Sinoti is a 20-year-old single woman with no children. She has a small business providing taxi services to the general public. She has more than three years experience with this business. Sinoti needs a loan to purchase vehicle tires and seat covers. She will use her profits to improve her family's standard of living. Sinoti joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy vehicle tires and seat covers

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en:
Rasela is a 20-year-old partnered woman, with two children. She has a business making and selling German buns to the local community. 

Rasela has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, plastic bags, and a large cooking pot. She joined SPBD in 2012. 

With her earnings, Rasela will help improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, plastic bags, and a large cooking pot

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуна родилась в 1993 года. Она трудолюбивая и перспективная девушка. Мавзуна в средней школе училась отлично и хорошо и всегда мечтала поступить в университет. Она 3 года назад окончила среднюю школу и поступила в университет. Мавзуна учится в Худжандском Государственном Университете. Она выбрала специальность Востоковедение. Она учит английский и арабский языки. Мавзуна мечтает после окончания университета стать переводчиком. Мавзуна обратилась за займом, чтобы оплатить за учебный договор. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора.
texts.en:
Mavzuna was born in 1993. She is a hardworking and promising young woman. Mavzuna studied with excellence in high school and always dreamed of going to university. Three years ago, she graduated from high school and enrolled in a university. Mavzuna is studying at Khujand State University. She chose the specialization Oriental Studies. She is studying English and Arabic. Mavzuna dreams of becoming a translator after graduation.

Mavzuna applied for a loan in order to pay tuition.

loans.use: to pay for her university education

loans.name: Paula Emilia

texts.es:
La señora Paula una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad en la zona  sur de Honduras junto a  sus  hijos y esposo. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas desde hace varios años.
Doña Paula tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación y vende sus productos a vecinos y amigos de lugares cercanos a su residencia. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más materia prima como carnes, arroz, pan, frijoles, cebollas, tomates, queso, repollo, remolachas, etc.  Para seguir realizando su actividad la cual forma la mayor parte de sus ingresos y así mismo desea bríndales más variad de comidas a sus clientes.
Doña Paula con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten de una forma y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes a diario y desea mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Paula su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que su hijos tenga los estudios necesarios para que tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre del  2013
texts.en:
Paula is a very hardworking, responsible person who lives in a village in southern Honduras with her husband and children. She has been selling food for a number of years.
Paula runs her business out of her one-room house and sells her food to neighbors and friends who live nearby. She needs the loan to buy more staple ingredients such as meat, rice, bread, beans, onions, tomatoes, cheese, cabbage, beets, etc., so she can keep running her business, which provides most of her income, and offer a wider variety of foods to her customers.
Paula hopes that this loan will help her increase her sales. It will help her a lot, since she doesn’t have the ingredients necessary to meet the requests her customers make every day. She hopes to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.
Paula’s dream is to grow her business so she can continue to support her family and offer her children an education so they have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, bread, beans, onions, tomatoes, cheese, cabbage, beets, and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: El Mejor Amigo De Jacubi Group

texts.es:
La señora Aura Marina de estado civil casada. De edad 38 años. De escolaridad Primaria completa. Tiene 4 hijos y de ellos 2 estan estudiando. Se dedica a la venta de refacciones ambulante. Inició este negocio por la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos del hogar y a la fecha lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de insumos para preparar refacciones. Desea en el futuro proximo tener un comedor en el centro del municipio.

Los demás integrantes del grupo se decian al comercio.
texts.en:
Aura Marina, 38 years old, is married. She finished primary school. She has four children, two of whom are in school. She sells food door to door. She started the business three years ago to help with the household expenses.

She has organized a group and is requesting a loan that she will use to buy supplies to prepare the food. In the future she would like to open a restaurant downtown.

The other members of the group are make a living selling various goods.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina works hard to support her family.  She has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Marina has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks of fish, hotdogs, meat, and chorizo to sell.

Marina has been in this business for 16 years now.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of fish, hotdogs, meat, and chorizo to sell

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
This is Mamerta, 64, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Valentin, her business partner, and they have children. Together, they manage their own household while operating a retail business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mamerta's business offers products like vinegar, oil, gas and charcoal. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy charcoal, vinegar, oil and gas needed in her business.

Mamerta dreams to have a grocery store and hopes to have her own house. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for charcoal, vinegar, oil and gas needed in her business.

loans.name: Yessica Yessenia

texts.es:
Yessica es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudada de Jayanca y para poder tener ingresos para salir adelante trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes desde hace 2 años, Yessica es muy amable con sus clientes y sobre todo se esfuerza mucho cada día ya que es madre de una pequeña a la cual cría sola ya que es madre soltera.

Yessica esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, artículos de bazar, entre otros; de esta manera podrá ofrecer mayores productos a sus clientes y pode mejorar sus ingresos y luchar por hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener un minimarket”.
texts.en:
Yessica is a hard-working woman. She lives in the city of Jayanca. In order to make some income and to get ahead she has been working in her small grocery store for the past two years. Yessica is very friendly with her customers and moreover she exerts herself every day as she is a single mother who is bringing up her young daughter by herself.

Yessica is grateful to the lenders at Kiva. Thanks to the support they have given her, she can buy merchandise for her business like rice, sugar, knick-knacks etc. In this way she can offer more products to her clients and can increases her revenue and struggle to make her dream come true: "to open a mini market.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.fr: Boniface est un jeune homme de 40 ans marié et père de famille. il est commerçant et a ouvert dans quartier de la capitale un petit comptoir dan lequel il commercialise les chaussures ainsi que le crédit de communication depuis 3 ans. il est à noter que c'est avec cette activité qu'il subvient aux besoin de sa famille.Son activité fonctionne bien surtout son call-box d'où son envie d'avoir ce crédit pour augmenter son stock de crédit de communication ainsi que ses ventes. ceci augmentera ses bénéfices. Bénéfices qui seront en partie réinvestis dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens des sa famille
texts.en: Boniface is a young man of 40, who is married with children. He is a shopkeeper and has a little stall in the capital in which he has been selling shoes and telephone credits for three years. It should be noted that it is through this business that he supports his family. His business is doing well, especially his call-box, which is why he wants a loan so that he can increase his stock of communication credits and his sales. Thus, he will increase his profit. He will re-invest part of his profit to expand his business  and the remainder will enable him to provide for his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of communication credits.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel  tiene la edad de 41 años, es casado y vive con la esposa y dos hijos actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado  y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a el y a su hija  a salir adelante. El espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Miguel is 41 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two children. He will use his loan to buy livestock and sell them for a profit once they have grown. His business will help him and his daughter have better lives. He hopes that this project will help him grow and achieve his goals so he can offer his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability. This is the first loan he's received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't received any prior loans from state banks, and FUDECOSUR is offering him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr: Rosalie est une jeune femme de 35 ans, mariée et mère de famille, .Elle gère un petit centre d'appels téléphonique(call box) dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 4 ans e .Elle s'approvisionne en crédit de communication auprès des opérateurs téléphoniques en moyenne 02 fois par semaine.Mais cependant,la demande de crédit et d'appel étant de plus en plus croissante,elle a du mal a satisfaire sa clientèle car son capital ne lui permet pas de s'approvisionner convenablement ce qui cause de constantes ruptures de stock et la perte progressive de sa clientèle.Elle sollicite dont ce crédit afin de s'approvisionner plus en crédit de communication,  ce qui lui permettra de retenir et accroître sa clientèle et par conséquent ses bénéfices.Bénéfices qui seront en partie réinvestis dans son activité afin de l'agrandir le reste lui permettra d'aider son époux  à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Rosalie is a young woman, 35 years old, married, and a mother of a family. She has been running a telephone call center (call box) in a district in the capital for four years. She gets her supplies of communication credits from telephone operators twice a week on average. However, since the demand for call credits is growing more and more, she has trouble satisfy her customers because her capital does not allow her to supply herself appropriately. This explains the constant inventory shortages and the progressive loss of customers. So she is requesting this loan to stock up on more communication credits enabling her to retain and increase her customer base and consequently her profits. Her profits will in part be reinvest in her business to expand it. And the rest will allow her to help her husband to meet family needs.

loans.use: to increase her call credit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Elieta

texts.en:
Elieta is a 34-year-old, partnered woman, with nine children. She has a business making and selling German buns in the local community.

Elieta has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, and plastic bags, as well as cement, timber, and iron roofing for home improvement. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2009. 

With her earnings, Elieta will help improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and plastic bags, as well as cement, timber, and iron roofing.

loans.name: Dana Kerti Group

texts.en: Desak Gede helps support her family and requests a loan to increase her pig business. With full support from her husband, Desak Gede will use her loan to purchase three local piglets for fattening. The local pigs will be sold in two months. The profits from her business pays for school fees. She hopes her children can gets a higher education for a better future. Now with seven members left, the Dana Kerti Group receives 12 million IDR in loans and from that, Desak Gede receives 2 million IDR. She hopes all her plans will run smoothly so she can earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase three piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
This is Merlinda, who is 54 years old and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Primitivo, a farmer, and they have children. Together with her husband and children, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies.

Merlinda operates a fruit stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines like bananas, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells papaya and other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of fruit to expand her product inventory.

Merlinda hopes that her business will continue its operation, and she dreams of giving her family a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more fruits needed in her business.

loans.name: Marie Christelle

texts.fr: Marie Christelle une  femme agée de 50 ans mariée, mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 10  et 25 ans . elle   exerce son activité à savoir un centre d'appel téléphonique et de transfert de crédit et aussi la vente des fruits au meme comptoir dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 3 ans déjà pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille. Actuellement, elle achète et vend les unités pour appels téléphoniques en détail et sa marge bénéficiaire n'est pas élévée. Elle souhaiterai acheter ses unités en gros pour vendre non seulement en détail, mais aussi en gros ce qui lui donnera plus de benéfices. Elle veut aussi augmenter le stock des fruits qu'elle vend sur le même comptoir (mangues et mandarines, oranges) en fonction des saisons.Le Benefice tiré de ce crédit, lui permettra d'augmenter à nouveau son fonds de commerce(réinvestir dans son activité en augmentant le montant du crédit de communication) et d'aider en partie son époux à subvenir aux  besoins quotidiens de leur petite famille.
texts.en:
Marie Christelle is a 50-year-old married woman and the mother of four children, from 10 to 25 years old. She has a business, a center for telephone calls and credit transfers, and she has also been selling fruit at the same table in a district in the capital for three years already. She does this in order to meet the needs of her small family. She currently buys and sells phone call units at the retail level, and her profit margin is not great. She would like to purchase her units wholesale not only to sell retail but also to sell in bulk, which will give her more in profit. She also wants to increase her stock of fruit (mangoes, tangerines, oranges), which she sells at the same table according to the season. 

The profit derived from this loan will enable her to increase once more her business capital, reinvest in her business, and increase the amount of communication credit to help in part her husband in meeting the day-to-day needs of their small family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and phone credit units.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en: Mercidita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling fish in the Philippines. Mercidita requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for one year now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Posia

texts.en:
Posia is a 39-year-old partnered woman with 6 children. 

She has a small plantation and grows mainly bananas and taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Posia has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weedkiller, a wheelbarrow, bush-knives and barbed wire. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Posia hopes to provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weedkiller, a wheelbarrow, bush knives and barbed wire

loans.name: Mawuli

texts.fr: Mawuli est une femme de 38ans mariée à un technicien en électricité avec un enfant de 2ans. Elle a démarrée depuis 2011 ; elle est revendeuse des ustensiles de cuisine et de jouets à tous clients dans une boutique. Elle sollicite son premier prêt auprès de WAGES pour acheter des ustensiles de cuisine et des jouets. Elle voudrait agrandir son marché et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mawuli is a 38-year-old woman who is married to an electrical technician. She has a 2-year-old child. Starting off in 2011, she has been selling kitchen utensils and toys to all comers in a store. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES to purchase some kitchen utensils and toys. She would like to expand her market and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils and toys to sell

loans.name: Samsonne

texts.fr: Samsonne est une femme célibataire de 31ans. Elle est revendeuse des produits d’alimentation générale à toutes personnes dans une boutique. Par cause de mévente, elle sollicite son second prêt auprès de WAGES pour épargner et acheter un terrain pour construire. Elle compte agrandir son marché et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Samsonne is a 31-year-old woman who is unmarried. She sells grocery items to anyone in her store. Due to a drop in sales, she is requesting a second loan from WAGES to save money and to purchase a plot of land on which to build. She plans on expanding her market and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase grocery supplies to sell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
This is Leticia, 59, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She has children and manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Leticia operates a bakery. Breads and spreads are staples in the usual Filipino cuisine and are used mostly for breakfast and snacks. The most popular type of bread is the Pandesal, a Filipino version of the Spanish Pan de Sal or salted bread. It is baked during the wee hours of the morning and sold steaming hot to early commuters, students and workers. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy raw supplies like flour, sugar, and butter, which she needs to continue production and expand her product inventory. 

Leticia dreams to find a better stall for her bakery and hopes to become rich. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients needed in baking like sugar, flour, eggs and milk.

loans.name: Onilo Fernando

texts.es:
El joven Onilo es una persona muy trabajadora, humilde  y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. El se dedica a la venta de productos básicos, en su negocio el cual es un mini súper mercado que tiene desde hace más de 10  años.
